    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9Emerald is sometimes considered the lesser Diamond. Everyone hunts for Diamond this, Diamond that, they forget about the Emerald! Until it comes trading time at the Village, then oops, Emeralds might be important again!

    But it definitely has its uses beyond a trade good. Emerald Armor, for example, is just slightly less robust than Diamond armor, but the tradeoff?

    A full set will make you move a heckuva lot faster!

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9Know how hard Obsidian is? Pretty blast resistant, a pain to collect if you find a patch of it. 

    So of course, we made some armor out of it! It's not much better than Iron, until you wear a full set of it. Then you get even more Resistant! Better than the sum of its pieces or... well, however that saying goes, merc.

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9Infused Lava Crystals are super useful, both powering our Workbenches, and helping to turn basic materials into hardy, powerful armaments.

    So of course we're going to make armor out of it!

    Not quite as good as Diamond armor, but I prefer it if I'm tredging into The Nether, as the full set will give you Fire Resistance!

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9You know, we in The Flock like our jokes. The world is a bleak place, so humor, parties, celebration keeps the spirits up!

    One day we decided to make some costumes with the Workbenches. They had the patterns, so why not? Hey, a chicken suit, that should be amusing! Chicken Armor? Weird name but okay.

    Whew. When one of us put on the full suit, none of us could catch them during Tag! So Speedy!

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9Slimes are strange creatures, merc. Really strange. They are kinda cute but will smash you and throw you off a cliff given a chance! If they are large enough, that is. The tiny ones are REALLY determined to at least try, I gotta say!

    Slime, the substance I mean this time, is pretty strange too. Kinda liquid, kinda solid. Make a block out of it, and its like a trampoline! So what about armor?

    Well, it kinda makes weak armor. But a full set of it? Makes you REALLY jumpy!

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9Ardite's a rare material that used to be found in The Nether. It made decently strong armaments, but was mostly used as part of a much stronger alloy!

    It's pretty durable stuff, pretty close to Diamond, but with the addition of being Fire Resistant if you wear the full set!

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9Cobalt used to be an uncommon ore you could gather in The Nether, but nowadays it's pretty rare to find when scavenging. It's pretty strong on its own, but it was mainly alloyed with another rare Nether metal.

    It's decent as armor on a piece by piece basis. But where it shines, merc, is the full set. It'll hasten those hands of yours, making digging through rubble and ruin much easier!

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9Ardite and Cobalt are decently strong metals on their own. But alloy them together? Well, merc, thats when you get something called Manyullyn. It's also a very pretty color too, I'd say!

    Not only is it strong and durable, it'll make YOU strong and durable too! A full set will not only protect you like Diamond armor, but make your attacks hit even harder!

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9To this day, none of us in The Flock can understand Pig Iron. It's a really weird alloy, that does really weird things! Some weapons made with it make Bacon pop out of enemies. 

    Yes, I said Bacon. 

    So, with that, what if we made some armor with it? We were able to retool the regular Iron recipe in the Workbench with Pig Iron and well...

    It's okay? Well actually its pretty decent out in the field. It helps keep your food Saturated! Not as much need to eat out in the field, merc! I mean, as long as you got a full set on.

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9Merc, I'm pretty sure you've seen our Slime armor, right? Not very protective, but really helpful in getting to higher ledges, scaling mountains and ruins, the usual!

    Well, we wanted something a bit more protective but still able to get you to places. So we used this strange alloy we found called Knightslime, to make an armor line somewhere between Iron and Slime armor.

    It ain't as protective as armor, but the full set will let you jump a lot higher. Not as much as Slime armor, but tradeoffs must be made, merc.

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9You got any spare Chainmail, Iron, Gold, or Diamond armor laying about, merc? You got a couple choices with it.

    You could probably sell it on the Flea Market for pennies. Maybe melt it down somehow to some useful resources.

    Or you can take our special Enhanced enchantment and toss it on your armor. Bam, upgraded!

§9Melee weapons may seem antiquated, but a good soldier always has a backup when their gun jams or they run out of metal to throw.

    These are pretty basic weapons, but each one can inflict more than just damage on an enemy : 

    The Coal Sword can Blind the target. The Redstone and Lapis Swords can make then Nauseated. The Emerald Sword can slow the target down.

    Each weapon purchase comes with your choice of pickaxe as well!

§9Bows are great weapons to use in place of guns. Arrows tend to be easier to make, and a lot of monsters don't easily shrug off the damage you can cause.

    Raider Scavs though, are another matter. You know, cause of armor?

    These aren't the best of materials to make a bow with, but they aren't bad!

    Each weapon purchase comes with your choice of pickaxe as well!

§9Melee weapons may seem antiquated, but a good soldier always has a backup when their gun jams or they run out of metal to throw.

    These are a bit beefier than their sword counterparts, and each one can inflict more than just damage on an enemy : 

    The Coal Battle Axe can Blind the target. The Redstone and Lapis Battle Axes can make then Nauseated. The Emerald Battle Axe can slow the target down.

    Each weapon purchase comes with your choice of pickaxe as well!

§9Melee weapons may seem antiquated, but a good soldier always has a backup when their gun jams or they run out of metal to throw.

    These are pretty basic weapons, but each one can inflict more than just damage on an enemy : 

    The Obsidian Sword can Weaken the target. The Lava Infused Sword can light the target on fire.

    Each weapon purchase comes with your choice of pickaxe as well!

§9Melee weapons may seem antiquated, but a good soldier always has a backup when their gun jams or they run out of metal to throw.

    These are a bit beefier than their sword counterparts, and each one can inflict more than just damage on an enemy : 

    The Obsidian Battle Axe can Weaken the target. The Lava Infused Battle Axe can light the target on fire.

    Each weapon purchase comes with your choice of pickaxe as well!

§9Bows are great weapons to use in place of guns. Arrows tend to be easier to make, and a lot of monsters don't easily shrug off the damage you can cause.

    Raider Scavs though, are another matter. You know, cause of armor?

    These aren't the best of materials to make a bow with, but they aren't bad!

    Each weapon purchase comes with your choice of pickaxe as well!

§9Melee weapons may seem antiquated, but a good soldier always has a backup when their gun jams or they run out of metal to throw.

    These are pretty basic weapons, but each one can inflict more than just damage on an enemy : 

    The Guardian Sword can Nauseate the target. 

    Each weapon purchase comes with your choice of pickaxe as well!

§9Bows are great weapons to use in place of guns. Arrows tend to be easier to make, and a lot of monsters don't easily shrug off the damage you can cause.

    Raider Scavs though, are another matter. You know, cause of armor?

    These aren't the best of materials to make a bow with, but they aren't bad!

    Each weapon purchase comes with your choice of pickaxe as well!

§9Melee weapons may seem antiquated, but a good soldier always has a backup when their gun jams or they run out of metal to throw.

    These are a bit beefier than their sword counterparts, and each one can inflict more than just damage on an enemy : 

    The Guardian Battle Axe can nauseate the target.

    Each weapon purchase comes with your choice of pickaxe as well!

§9Melee weapons may seem antiquated, but a good soldier always has a backup when their gun jams or they run out of metal to throw.

    These are pretty basic weapons, but each one can inflict more than just damage on an enemy : 

    The Super Star Sword Withers the target, and the Ender Dragon Sword Wither's the target even more.

    The Pickaxes are special too. The Super Star Pickaxe can drop Soul Sand when mining Sand, or Netherrack when mining Stone.

    Each weapon purchase comes with your choice of pickaxe as well!

§9Bows are great weapons to use in place of guns. Arrows tend to be easier to make, and a lot of monsters don't easily shrug off the damage you can cause.

    Raider Scavs though, are another matter. You know, cause of armor?

    These aren't the best of materials to make a bow with, but they aren't bad!

    Each weapon purchase comes with your choice of pickaxe as well!

    The Pickaxes are special too. The Super Star Pickaxe can drop Soul Sand when mining Sand, or Netherrack when mining Stone.

§9Melee weapons may seem antiquated, but a good soldier always has a backup when their gun jams or they run out of metal to throw.

    These are a bit beefier than their sword counterparts, and each one can inflict more than just damage on an enemy : 

    The Super Star Battle Axe can Wither the target, and the Ender Dragon Battle Axe can Wither them harder.

    Each weapon purchase comes with your choice of pickaxe as well!

§9Bows are great weapons to use in place of guns. Arrows tend to be easier to make, and a lot of monsters don't easily shrug off the damage you can cause.

    Raider Scavs though, are another matter. You know, cause of armor?

    These aren't the best of materials to make a bow with, but they aren't bad!

    Each weapon purchase comes with your choice of pickaxe as well!

    The Pickaxes are special too. The Super Star Pickaxe can drop Soul Sand when mining Sand, or Netherrack when mining Stone.

§9The Ultimate Armor. The top tier of the top tier in personal defense, merc! 

    The creation of such an armor is quite an undertaking, with a cost to match.

    But you can help make both of our jobs easier, merc. Each piece of Ultimate Armor is made up of smaller pieces, each piece containing another piece of armor. This is how it blends so many benefits into one armor : It contains 4 other entire sets of armor!

    Where was I? Oh, right! It takes a lot of time and energy and resources to make a piece of Ultimate Armor, so in the old days each piece was split into 3 parts, and manufacturing was done by multiple different Workshops.

    You can still find those pieces of armor as salvge. If you can get one of those, we'll pay you a decent amount for them!

§9These odd trophies seem to pop up every once on a while. They are different than the ones we're used to, and it seems our predecessors made mini holographic trophies to commemorate the various creatures in the world.

    If you can find one of them, we'll pay for them. We're trying to complete collections in many of The Flock's workshops.

§9Arms and Armor manufacturers had a wide variety of workbenches and machines to do their job. Some of them were pretty simple things that required no power, all they needed were the tools and components built in.

    The Camo Bench is useful in changing how a lot of blocks look, mostly our TechGun line of blocks, but occasionally some others too, like Wool.

    The Repair Bench is tooled specifically to help you repair TechGun armor lines.

§9Manufacturers used a wide variety of workbenches to make so many things. It's not as easy for us to make the benches just like they had (lack of giant sprawling factories and precision micro fabricators is an issue...)

    So we always are on the look out for salvaged versions from mercs like yourself. The Camo Bench and Repair Bench are pretty common ones, but we'll still buy the pair from ya.

§9We sell a variety of arms to protect yourself while out scavenging, merc. And with such a wide variety of firearms, comes a wide variety of ammunition!

§9Some of the things we create are so fantastical we can hardly believe them sometimes. Well, only sometimes. 

    Take this Anti-Gravity device. Place it on your back and you fly around like some sort of magic wielding diety. It'll slowly break down, but you'll get a good amount of flight time out of each one!

§9Without the lights of cities being everywhere, the darkness is quite a bit darker nowadays, merc. And that's dangerous when you are out scavenging, because who knows what, or who, is lurking and sneaking about?

    With these Night Vision goggles, you can cut through that and get a good view of the situation. They'll slowly consume charge of the Redstone Battery, but just throw it into a Charging Station or something to fix that!

§9Many TechGun machines, like the Fabricator, can be upgraded to work faster if you toss these Machine Upgrades into them.

    They stack up to 7 of em, each one making em faster and faster!

§9We have a lot of little pieces of gear that might be useful to you in various situations, merc. They all cost about the same, so just choose one from this list : 

    The Gas Mask protects you from breathing in Radiation.

    A pair of Gas Mask Filters, since eventually they will run out in the mask.

    An Oxygen mask, which lets you breath underwater or in other low oxygen situations.

    An Oxygen Tank, which you need to wear with the Oxygen Mask. Refill it with a Compressed Air Tank when it runs out.

    Mining Gloves, which help speed up your mining ability when worn.

    Tactical Mask, which is very tactical and protects your face.

    A Beret, which looks 100% awesome.

§9Along with Armor and Arms, we produce a bunch of helpful gadgets for mercs to utilize in their salvage ops. Backpack contained systems are quite popular, for example!

    The Glider lets you... well, glide, if you hold Sneak while falling! Instead of just falling like a rock that is. It doesn't require recharging or replacing components like the other gadgets here.

    The Jump Pack uses Compressed Air tanks, and lets you leap up pretty high! It also lowers fall damage, cause what use is it if you leap up only to land and break a leg? Oh, you might want to disable your "Auto Step Up" in the options, unless you like superleaping everywhere...

    The Jetpack uses Fuel Tanks and lets you fly around. It doesn't lower fall damage so try not to run out of Fuel mid flight, merc...

§9There's a couple useful tools we sell. Okay we sell a lot of tools, but these two are sort of special

    The Crowbar is kind of like a Wrench. You can hit people with it, but you can also Right Click it on TechGun machines to rotate them around. Sneak + Right Click can either dismantle machines, or in the case of TechGun doors, configure their security settings.

§9What good is a base of operations if the only entrance is protected by a flimsy wooden door?

    This variety of TechGuns brand doors are much better! You can Sneak + Right Click our Crowbar or another wrench onto them to configure them. 

    The Hangar doors connect to each other as well, so when you activate one, any of them 'touching' will activate at the same time.

§9Did you hit one of the irradiated areas, merc? Hopefully you have some Anti-RAD drugs on ya.

    No? Well, we always have a lot to spare. Some of the materials we work with have been irradiated from one disaster or another, until we de-RAD it at least.

    Anti-RAD Pills will heal a bit of Radiation buildup and boost your natural defenses against it.

    RadAway will rapidly heal a lot of Radiation buildup over time.

§9Now I know it's not a great look to Villagers, but Bandit Armor is widely worn for a reason.

    With it on, you are freer to move around, getting about faster. You also can fall from higher locations, and take less damage if you land hard.

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9The Miner's Outfit is a great bit of cheaper armor, because not only does it protect you a bit, it also increases your mining speed!

    You also move around faster as well!

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

    Power Armor requires the Chest piece to function. It will automatically 'load' replacement power items when it runs out, as long as its in your inventory.

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9The HEV Suit is a long sought after piece of kit, both useful and quite iconic. It is powered by Energy Cells.

    The HEV Suit provides decent protection against RADs and knockback, it also boosts both regular and underwater mining speeds!

    Power Armor requires the Chest piece to function. It will automatically 'load' replacement power items when it runs out, as long as its in your inventory.

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9The top tier of TechGun armors, iconic and strong. It is powered by Energy Cells.

    Power Armor boosts the wearer's heatlh outright, and adds a decent amount of knockback protection and a boost to mining speed.

    Power Armor requires the Chest piece to function. It will automatically 'load' replacement power items when it runs out, as long as its in your inventory.

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9Our TechGuns line of arms and armor and machines have some little things that the customer should know about.

    So there is a handy dandy manual you can purchase to help you out!

§2Bandit, we've been contacted by a group that calls themselves The YAP. Yes, I know, I thought so too. I've looked into them and they are... legitimate, in a way. They are an approved Trader group, at least.

    According to the VanilModu they are thieves, but honorable ones. And with a good fashion sense. They are primarily interested in clothing and goods from a wide variety of sources

    I'll patch you in to their representative : §r

§b-------------------
    Yo. Bandit, was it? Or merc? Nah I like Bandit, it's a good name, yeh! New mercs are always nice, especially interesting ones. Very interesting ones. Nah that's not important right now, but you are probably wondering about us, yeh? Well...

    Having trouble getting somewhere? The YAP can help you; worldwide. Got some odd salvage? The YAP can buy it; certified. Need to look good in this wasteland? The YAP can dress you; verified.

    A lot of this world is abandoned and full of rough and tumble scavs. Lots to explore, lots to loot. And lots of ways to make a fashion statement.

    Okay, how about you get us me some materials? Basic stuff we need to make some fantastic threads and good defensive weapons, yeh?
-------------------§r

    §oHmm, not the first time I've had to work with seedier individuals. Something tells me they are on the up and up, as long as I'm not a scav...
No Description

§bSometimes when you beat a scav at their own game, their magic life essence hits the ground. Looks like a video game heart! In that state, you can't really do anything with it though.

    I mean, other than sell it to us, yeh! We know how to turn them into useful accessories.

    The Red Heart is the most common you can find, so they won't get you much. Better than the Flea Market though!

§bWhat a rough world it is, Bandit. Quite rough. Hazardous, even, yeh. Armor's a good way to protect yourself, but it can slow you down. And there's things, both creatures and weapons, that can slice through armor like butter. And armor, even sealed power armor, is no good against certain magic.

    What's a mercenary to do, hm? Well, The YAP has a solution for you. It's called Baubley Heart Canisters.

    Sometimes the magic force of a creature flutters to the ground. Their heart? Nah, just a bit of magic shaped like a heart. Looks like a video game heart, if you've come across any working game system these days.

    Anyways, we in The YAP know how to turn these into nice little accessories to increase your health. Each one stacks up to 10 in one of your Bauble accessory slots (see that little circle in your Inventory portrait? click it!).

    There's four colors of Heart Canister, each one rarer than the last.

    Red is the most common, and therefore the cheapest!

§b    Nice work. Got some threads spinning up now, yeah? You can see some of the stuff we offer now, Bandit. Some threads, some personal protection, some tools of the trade. All that look good to you, eh?§r

    §o"Definitely, but there isn't much selection, you know?"§r

§b    Hah, of course not! You don't show your best goods right off the bat! Who knows how well you'll do as a mercenary, right? No use getting our good threads all torn up cause you got in a losing fight.

    Hey, there's a good test! Why don't you do what mercs do best, and thats go hunting! Some of those Scav Raiders are sporting our threads, and that isn't cool. So drop a few of them, and bring me back some Unsearched Loot, okay?

§b    Not bad at all, Bandit! That was some good hunting. And you helped recover some of our merchandise. You should have access to a good chunk of our fashions now, and a few more tools too. But fashion never rests, and I figure you'd like access to most the rest of our offerings, yeah? §r

    §o"Sure, but I'm a bit more interested in those hearts..."§r

§b    Hah, of course! Can't show off the threads if you ain't got the heart, yeh. Don't worry, we got plenty more of those to offer you. But how to feel better about your standing, hmm....

    Ah, yeah yeah, how about you rescue a few outfits for us, and get us the materials to patch up all the holes and stuff?

§b    Hmmm, those Scav Raiders do quite a number on the threads they wear. Geez. At least we can repair em, clean em up, and get them to more deserving mercenaries. Like yourself, Bandit!

    But hey, more important things to talk about, yeh? Okay, we don't have much to offer at our higher ranks. Keeping our best threads off the street ain't our style. But we still go the tools to keep you alive, especially those hearts you like so much. So what should we do now, hm... §r

    §o"Uh, I've already gotten you repair materials, hunted down Scavs, and built a few outfits for you. What's left?"§r

§b    That's a good question, Bandit. We could have you just get more outfits, we always need more, but... §r

    §2"What about cash?"§r

§b    Cash? Heh, simple but I like it. Fashion don't make the world go round, but it sure does make you look good doing it. §r

    §o"So money is my next task?"§r

§b    Yeh, that sounds fine. Get us some stacks of cash, don't matter how you go about it.

§b    Whew, you are a force of fashion, Bandit. Cold, hard cash, right in my paw. I love it.

    So I've wracked my brain. I know you want access to that final Heart amulet. That's the best thing we got to offer to the best Mercenaries. I could have you hunt down a bunch more Scav Raiders, or get me more repair materials, or all that jazz, but nah. I think I'll keep it simple. §r

    §o"Simple how?"§r

§b    We'll just keep on our best ideas, of course. And what's The YAP good at, Z? §r

    §2"Fashion."§r

§b    Exactly. Fashion. So all we want is a dozen or so full outfits. Put together some good stuff for us, and that Heart Amulet will be yours (for a price, yeh!)

§bBandit, if you ever come across one of these empty heart canisters, we'll buy em. The YAP members sometimes fall in battle and their goods looted, and empty canisters are commonly amongst their belongings.

§bTougher creatures have bigger life forces. Takes a lot to take them down, and their life magic is likewise bigger, and harder to contain.

    There's four colors of Heart Canister, each one rarer than the last.

    Orange is the next step up from Red.

§bHave you faced down The Wither yet? Maybe some other imposingly dangerous monster? Betcha the life heart they dropped was Orange instead of Red!

    Heart Canisters can only stack up to 10, but more powerful hearts mean more powerful life forces means BIGGER STACKS, Bandit!

§bVery few creatures have the life force to overcome the Orange Heart Barrier. 

    But there is one, hovering around The End. The YAP knows how to contain that life force for a price.

    There's four colors of Heart Canister, each one rarer than the last.

    Green hearts are the second rarest heart canister.
§bSquared off against the Ender Dragon have you? Got a nice green heart? Yeah I know it should probably be red or orange for fire...or maybe purple. But it's green, and its worth a lot to us!

§bSometimes, it isn't about how strong your own life force is, but how much you can steal from others.

    Tales tell of an evil Illager deep in the woods who carries the blue heart. We've come across a few blue hearts in our trades, and The YAP has wares to sell, of course.

    There's four colors of Heart Canister, each one rarer than the last.

    Blue is the rarest heart to find.

§bTrapse off into the woods, Bandit. Find a spooky mansion, maybe bring a dog along and a weird guy in an ascot as well. Unmask the... oh wait, it's not a mask, its an evil Illager! And he's stolen a lot of life essence.

    If you are lucky, the Illager might have dropped a Blue Heart, the gathered life force.

§bFinding other things you want to accessorise yourself with, but finding Heart Canisters too valuable?

    The YAP has a solution! The Heart Amulet can carry all four types of Heart Canisters, and only take one Bauble slot!

§bThe burned skeletons in The Nether are special, sought after by multiple Traders, including ourselves! They are part of the secret of unlocking the Heart Canister!

    They drop multiple kinds of bones. Others Traders are interested in other bones, but The YAP is interested in Wither Bones!
§bIt is a long shot, but if you come across one of these Jewel Apples, Bandit, we'll buy em from you. Why? Oh, quite a delicacy, and something quite special.

§bGrappling hooks are a super useful tools, aren't they? We can manufacture them from base resources, but that takes time, ya know? Hey, you should be able to find some good pieces scavenging around, and we'll pay ya for em.

§bEver try scaling a mountain with just your paws, Bandit? It kinda sucks, yeh? Sure, you can just build up some dirt under you to make it easier, but its just slow! 

    What about buildings? Scaling buildings I mean. That's even tougher without a tool! That's where Grappling Hooks come in!

    Now... various YAP members swear by two 'brands' of Grappling Hook. The more common ones you'll find are Hooked brand. You can toss em onto a Baubles slot (that little circle next to your paperdoll in your inventory, click it!) and they'll always be ready!

    The Iron Hook lets you fire off up to two hooks using the C Key. If you have two hooks out, you'll hang in the middle between them.

    Sneak + C while looking at a hook to unhook it.

    Jump to unhook all hooks.

§bEver try scaling a mountain with just your paws, Bandit? It kinda sucks, yeh? Sure, you can just build up some dirt under you to make it easier, but its just slow! 

    What about buildings? Scaling buildings I mean. That's even tougher without a tool! That's where Grappling Hooks come in!

    Now... various YAP members swear by two 'brands' of Grappling Hook. The more common ones you'll find are Hooked brand. You can toss em onto a Baubles slot (that little circle next to your paperdoll in your inventory, click it!) and they'll always be ready!

    The Red Hook lets you fire off up to four hooks using the C Key. You can then 'fly' around between the hooks (use Sneak and Jump to move down and up).

    Sneak + C while looking at a hook to unhook it.

    Double Jump to unhook all hooks.

§bEver try scaling a mountain with just your paws, Bandit? It kinda sucks, yeh? Sure, you can just build up some dirt under you to make it easier, but its just slow! 

    What about buildings? Scaling buildings I mean. That's even tougher without a tool! That's where Grappling Hooks come in!

    Now... various YAP members swear by two 'brands' of Grappling Hook. The more common ones you'll find are Hooked brand. You can toss em onto a Baubles slot (that little circle next to your paperdoll in your inventory, click it!) and they'll always be ready!

    The Diamond Hook lets you fire off up to four hooks using the C Key. You'll hang in the center of all hooks.

    You can also swap to Single Hook mode by holding the Diamond Hook and Sneak + Right Clicking in the air.

    Sneak + C while looking at a hook to unhook it.

    Jump to unhook all hooks.

§bEver try scaling a mountain with just your paws, Bandit? It kinda sucks, yeh? Sure, you can just build up some dirt under you to make it easier, but its just slow! 

    What about buildings? Scaling buildings I mean. That's even tougher without a tool! That's where Grappling Hooks come in!

    Now... various YAP members swear by two 'brands' of Grappling Hook. The more common ones you'll find are Hooked brand. You can toss em onto a Baubles slot (that little circle next to your paperdoll in your inventory, click it!) and they'll always be ready!

    The Ender Hook lets you fire off a single hook using the C Key. While you only get one hook, it is VERY fast!

    Jump to unhook.

§bEver try scaling a mountain with just your paws, Bandit? It kinda sucks, yeh? Sure, you can just build up some dirt under you to make it easier, but its just slow! 

    What about buildings? Scaling buildings I mean. That's even tougher without a tool! That's where Grappling Hooks come in!

    Now... various YAP members swear by two 'brands' of Grappling Hook. The less popular one, but vastly more customizable, is the Grappling Hooke (Original name, I know, yeh). It's a bit more complicated to use, but you can customize it with upgrades to make it more personal!

    The instructions can be seen on the Grappling Hook itself, but as a quick rundown : 

    Right Click to throw a Hook out, and Right Click to Release a Hook.

    Double Right Click to Release and Throw immediately, good when scaling high areas.

    W A S D will swing you around.

    Jump will Release the hook and propel you upward.

    Sneak will stop your Swinging.

    Sneak + W will pull you towards the Hook.

    Sneak + S will reel you away from the Hook.

    ALONG with the Grappling Hook, you can purchase two companion tools.

    The Ender Staff will launch you in the direction you aim it and Right Click. THIS DOES NOT STOP FALL DAMAGE! 

    The Magnetic Forcefield can be turned on and off with Right Click. While on, it will constantly push you away from all nearby blocks. Helpful when using the Ender Staff.

§bYour Grappling Hook is a very customizable little thing. And to do so, you'll need this special work station, along with the proper Upgrade installed.

    Installing Upgrades is simple! Just hold and Right Click the upgrade onto the Grappling Hook Modifier!

betterquesting:10.name:8: [I] Selling : Grappling Hook Upgrades - Tier I
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
§bYour Grappling Hook is a very customizable little thing. Take an Upgrade, Right Click it onto a Grappling Hook Modifier, then Right Click the Modifier with an empty hand to configure all your upgrades.

    When ready, Right Click your Grappling Hook onto the Modifier to set it up, and get to swinging!

    Tier I upgrades come in three flavors : 

    The Swing Upgrade lets you change the speed of your swing.

    The Motor Upgrade lets you change how fast you reel yourself in or out.

    The Rope Upgrade lets you change how long your rope can be.

betterquesting:10.name:8: [II] Selling : Grappling Hook Upgrades - Tier II
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
§bYour Grappling Hook is a very customizable little thing. Take an Upgrade, Right Click it onto a Grappling Hook Modifier, then Right Click the Modifier with an empty hand to configure all your upgrades.

    When ready, Right Click your Grappling Hook onto the Modifier to set it up, and get to swinging!

    Tier II upgrades come in three flavors : 

    Magnet Hook Upgrade lets you magnetize the Hook itself, so that it attracts towards blocks when thrown.

    The Double Hook Upgrade lets you throw two hooks out at once. Good for swinging down streets and alleyways with walls on either side.

    The Hook Thrower Upgrade lets you change how far, fast, and more with throwing the hook out.

betterquesting:10.name:8: [III] Selling : Grappling Hook Upgrades - Tier III
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
§bYour Grappling Hook is a very customizable little thing. Take an Upgrade, Right Click it onto a Grappling Hook Modifier, then Right Click the Modifier with an empty hand to configure all your upgrades.

    When ready, Right Click your Grappling Hook onto the Modifier to set it up, and get to swinging!

    Tier III upgrades come in three flavors : 

    The Ender Staff Upgrade lets you propel yourself with Left Click, like the Ender Staff. It still doesn't cut out falling damage so be careful!

    The Forcefield Upgrade will propel you away from neary blocks when you have something Hooked.

betterquesting:10.name:8: [IV] Selling : Grappling Hook Upgrades - Tier IV
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
§bYour Grappling Hook is a very customizable little thing. Take an Upgrade, Right Click it onto a Grappling Hook Modifier, then Right Click the Modifier with an empty hand to configure all your upgrades.

    When ready, Right Click your Grappling Hook onto the Modifier to set it up, and get to swinging!

    Tier IV upgrades come in one flavor, but theres also a nice little bonus item you can purchase too : 

    Limits Upgrade removes the limiter on the Modifier station. Usually these settings are for your safety but, hey, it's your hide on the line, not us!

    The Long Fall Boots solve the problem with high speed grappling and Force Staff jumps. Fall damage, what's that? 

    Yeah you can just Right Click a pair of Diamond Boots with Feather Fall IV on the Modifier station to make these, but buying them is a lot easier!

§bBandit, you ever come across one of these? It's an air drop beacon. There's some mysterious group who has set these things around. None of us traders have figured out who, but The YAP surmises its actually an automated system from before the second Calamity.

    So basically when you find one, you got a choice : 

    Right Click it, then guard it for 5 minutes. An air drop pod will land and bring you some loot. It's mostly random, usually food, or some useless junk. Occasionally it'll be useful, like ammo or a weapon!

    Or, you can break the beacon without activating it, and sell it to us. Each one we get lets us get closer to figuring out who this group is.

    Why? Cause you don't do anything for free. So what's the cost here, hmm?

§bPay attention to the places you loot, Bandit. You can find lots of useful things beyond just the stuff you can dig out of shelves and boxes. Like the shelves and boxes themselves!

    We're primarily interested in the kind of storage you can find in gas stations, convenience stores, and certain bars. 

    Store Shelving and Barrels are pretty obvious.

    Air drops...these only show up if you activate certain Beacons you can sometimes find. They double as really weird and cool looking storage!

display:10.Name:8: Store Shelf, Barrel, or Air Drop

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
§bHey Bandit. Got a little proposition for ya.

    You've probably come across a lot of random items. Nails, wire, screws, bits and bobs. Well, Some of them we're looking to collect.

    Sometimes we need a specific screw to fix something, and its easier to just ask for piles of screws than ask for a two inch long self-drilling raised-cheese head screw.

    Other times, we just need a bunch of wire or random electronic components.

    Hey, we just buy it from ya, reasoning isn't that important, yeh?

§bNow, I know the order of the day for survival is a firearm at your side, Bandit, but nothing beats a good melee weapon in a pinch. Plus if you run out of ammo, you best have one on your belt. Or have an iron fist at least, cause punching armor isn't fun. Personally? Run and come back later.

    We collect a lot of variety of weapons for folks to purchase. General stuff  you can find in houses and small businesses, sure, but hey, we don't gotta make em, just sell em!

    These weapons are your common household items with a good bit of reach. Classic baseball bat, golf club, and a crowbar. Okay the crowbar isn't as common, unless you are in The YAP, then its stock trade, yeh.

§bNow, I know the order of the day for survival is a firearm at your side, Bandit, but nothing beats a good melee weapon in a pinch. Plus if you run out of ammo, you best have one on your belt. Or have an iron fist at least, cause punching armor isn't fun. Personally? Run and come back later.

    We collect a lot of variety of weapons for folks to purchase. General stuff  you can find in houses and small businesses, sure, but hey, we don't gotta make em, just sell em!

    A good tool has multiple uses. For us, that is usually breaking something, either a lock or a face. The Wrench, Spanner, and Hammer are all heavy tools that get the job done.

§bNow, I know the order of the day for survival is a firearm at your side, Bandit, but nothing beats a good melee weapon in a pinch. Plus if you run out of ammo, you best have one on your belt. Or have an iron fist at least, cause punching armor isn't fun. Personally? Run and come back later.

    We collect a lot of variety of weapons for folks to purchase. General stuff  you can find in houses and small businesses, sure, but hey, we don't gotta make em, just sell em!

    These weapons don't hide what they are used for, and in a pinch are good for intimidation just holding them. The Switchblade, Rusty Pipe, and Nightstick are pretty common to see.

§bNow, I know the order of the day for survival is a firearm at your side, Bandit, but nothing beats a good melee weapon in a pinch. Plus if you run out of ammo, you best have one on your belt. Or have an iron fist at least, cause punching armor isn't fun. Personally? Run and come back later.

    We collect a lot of variety of weapons for folks to purchase. General stuff  you can find in houses and small businesses, sure, but hey, we don't gotta make em, just sell em!

    A shiny sharpened (or extremely blunt...) piece of metal is a good deterrant against scav raiders. Zombies, eh... but thats why they are functional as well! The Shiv, Baseball Bat, Kitchen Knife, and Hunting Knife are nice and shiny. Okay, so the Shiv isn't that shiny but...

§bNow, I know the order of the day for survival is a firearm at your side, Bandit, but nothing beats a good melee weapon in a pinch. Plus if you run out of ammo, you best have one on your belt. Or have an iron fist at least, cause punching armor isn't fun. Personally? Run and come back later.

    We collect a lot of variety of weapons for folks to purchase. General stuff  you can find in houses and small businesses, sure, but hey, we don't gotta make em, just sell em!

    These weapons got a bit of red flair to them. I mean, only one of them is paint, the others aren't. Whatever it is up to you I guess! The Nailed Bat, Machete, and Fire Axe are big, heavy, and make a statement.

§bNow, I know the order of the day for survival is a firearm at your side, Bandit, but nothing beats a good melee weapon in a pinch. Plus if you run out of ammo, you best have one on your belt. Or have an iron fist at least, cause punching armor isn't fun. Personally? Run and come back later.

    We collect a lot of variety of weapons for folks to purchase. General stuff  you can find in houses and small businesses, sure, but hey, we don't gotta make em, just sell em!

    These are the best we got. Which isn't much compared to other Traders, but also far from as expensive, yeh? The Katana and the Sledgehammer are a whole lotta metal and bring a whole lotta hurt.

§bOut in wasteland that is our Overworld, sometimes you'll need a tool to get through something. A locked door, some barbed wire, an annoying scav raider.

    Here's some tools you MIGHT find useful. Whether they are or not, I can't say. But hey, the can opener can open some canned food at the least!

§bPay attention to the places you loot, Bandit. You can find lots of useful things beyond just the stuff you can dig out of shelves and boxes. Like the shelves and boxes themselves!

    Found some Wire Cutters? Maybe a Kitchen Knife? How about a Spanner? Hey, we could use em!

§bPay attention to the places you loot, Bandit. You can find lots of useful things beyond just the stuff you can dig out of shelves and boxes. Like the shelves and boxes themselves!

    You can find lots of packaged foodstuffs around. Canned, wrapped, wax coated boxes. A lot of them are so stuffed with preservatives they'll still be edible after the next two calamaties!

§bBandit, there's a lot of lines of clothing out there, but most of them are premade pieces, that you mix and match together into an outfit.

    That's all well and good, and a big part of the fun and skill of fashion, but sometimes you want something that you designed yourself.

    The YAP has something just for you! The Wearables line of clothing! Various pieces of clothing you can colorize, mix, and combine together to get yourself a fully customized outfit!

    How to create your outfit : 

    1) To start with, you'll need this Wearables Colorizer and Wearables Assembler.

    2) Place each Wearables component into the Colorizer. The Colorizer will let you customize each Wearables component, changing colors and everything.

    3) Take the colored components to the Assembler. The Assembler lets you combine multiple Wearables pieces that go onto the same spot. It also lets  you add in an armor piece for the protection aspects!

   You can, say, combine a top hat with a stylish pair of glasses, along with a Diamond Helmet. Bam, looking stylish AND protected!

    4) Put on your new stylish armor!

§bGot some armor or outfits you wanna show off? Then buy one of these Wearable brand mannequins!

    The full Mannequin shows you your own equipment on the right, and the mannequin's on the left. Easily swap back and forth!

    The Mannequin Head Stand is just to show off neat hats you've made or got.
§bHelmets are the fairly common head Wearable component. There's two styles, one that covers the ears (well, on humans...) and one that does not.

§bA helmet is nice for an armor costume, but sometimes you want to just look really dapper,  yeh? 

    Or maybe a bit more pointy? Dragon horns are good for that!

§bGetting caught out during a New Moon sucks without the proper gear, Bandit. Who knows what scavs are lurking in the dark?

    Adding the Nightvision Goggles to an outfit will help solve that little issue!
§bEyewear is very important for fashion! The glasses frame the face and give a good insight on the wearer's views!

§bPerhaps the biggest canvas on your body, the torso! Shirts are good at showing off your style.

    There's multiple styles, open collar, long sleeve, short sleeve, and more!
§bGot a stylish shirt on? How about adding a nice bow tie to it? Sometimes, the 'stuffy' business look can look quite chill with the right ensemble!
§bCapes are a risque accessory but style favors the bold!

§bWhat's better than fashionable form? Fashionable function!

    The Jetpack is a great addition to an outfit. Not only does it look fashionably techy, it also works! It needs Jetpack Fuel to work, which you can easily whip up from salvaged materials.

    The Wings don't require fuel, but work a bit different. I'm sure you can figure it out!

§bLeg covers give a few less options than torso, but they are no less important!

    You can choose between full pants, or just boots covering!
§bAside from shoes, you can go for the interesting stylistic choice of adding large flippers to your outfit! They actually help you move around underwater, to boot!

§bChances are you'll find some of our Wearables products out in the wild. Usually just the components though.

    We'll gladly buy them back from you. We can always refurbish, repair, and send em back out to fashion minded mercs like yourself, Bandit!

§bThere isn't much of a government sanctioned police force these days. Villages and towns employee various private factions to guard them, and some gang and pirate groups defend territories. I wouldn't call all of them good or bad specifically, cause you could say The YAP is kind of all of those wheelhouses, yeh?

    Anyways, police uniforms are popular to use for these guard forces. There are three 'tiers' of the standard officer uniform here.

    The YAP is committed to giving you options when it comes to fashion! Each purchase comes with two choices : The first is either a hat or a set of boots, the second is either a chest piece or a set of leggings.

§bThere isn't much of a government sanctioned police force these days. Villages and towns employee various private factions to guard them, and some gang and pirate groups defend territories. I wouldn't call all of them good or bad specifically, cause you could say The YAP is kind of all of those wheelhouses, yeh?

    Anyways, police uniforms are popular to use for these guard forces, and larger cities employ larger forces. Some of them need more specific positions and a hierarchy, I guess, so agent uniforms cover them. From detectives to head officers.

    The YAP is committed to giving you options when it comes to fashion! Each purchase comes with two choices : The first is either a hat or a set of boots, the second is either a chest piece or a set of leggings.

I wouldn't call all of them good or bad specifically, cause you could say The YAP is kind of all of those wheelhouses, yeh?

    The YAP is committed to giving you options when it comes to fashion! Each purchase comes with two choices : The first is either a hat or a set of boots, the second is either a chest piece or a set of leggings.

§bDoctors and Surgeons are fantastic folk. Their fashion sense is simple, straight forward, and when you see it, you know who you are looking at!

    The YAP is committed to giving you options when it comes to fashion! Each purchase comes with two choices : The first is either a hat or a set of boots, the second is either a chest piece or a set of leggings.

§bCostumes are fashion too! Takes a good eye to make a good costume, yeh?

    Creeper costumes are popular around halloween. Chicken ones are always good for a laugh!

    The YAP is committed to giving you options when it comes to fashion! Each purchase comes with two choices : The first is either a hat or a set of boots, the second is either a chest piece or a set of leggings.

§bRawr! Big and color dinosaur costumes! Dance!

    Like I said, odd, right?

§bFun fun in the sun, and looking good while staying cool! Hopefully at least!

    The YAP is committed to giving you options when it comes to fashion! Each purchase comes with two choices : The first is either a hat or a set of boots, the second is either a chest piece or a set of leggings.

§bA lot of clothing pieces don't really have a full outfit. They are meant to complement other single pieces. Like, you COULD go with a full black jeans, black long sleeve shirt, black hat, and black boots, and thats a valid fashion choice!

    But using the black jeans to accent a white tiger striped shirt? With black boots, white laces, and a slick pair of shades? Bam, fashion upgraded, yeh!

    The YAP is committed to giving you options when it comes to fashion! Each purchase comes with two choices : The first is either a hat or a set of boots, the second is either a chest piece or a set of leggings.

§bA good hat is the cap on a good outfit. It can help bring it all together, AND protect your noggin, yeh!

    While all of these seem to have full outfits... only the helmet is actually a hat. The rest of the pieces look like Iron Armor for strange reasons.

    The YAP is committed to giving you options when it comes to fashion! Each purchase comes with two choices : The first is either a hat or a set of boots, the second is either a chest piece or a set of leggings.

    The Rainbowflowercrown helmet is the only floral piece on it. The rest looks like Iron Armor. Not very flowery I have to say!

    The YAP is committed to giving you options when it comes to fashion! Each purchase comes with two choices : The first is either a hat or a set of boots, the second is either a chest piece or a set of leggings.

§bT-shirts, whether they are short or long sleeved, can be central pieces to any outfit you put together. They are like large canvases, letting you show off or say what you want! Pair them with some stylish headware for a creative look!

    The body of the T-shirt outfits is a shorter sleeve, and the `leggings' are actually a longer sleeve shirt!

    Only the helmet of the glasses, headphones, and earmuffs are unique. The rest of the pieces are Iron Armor for some reason.

    The YAP is committed to giving you options when it comes to fashion! Each purchase comes with two choices : The first is either a hat or a set of boots, the second is either a chest piece or a set of leggings.

    The Cupcaketee and Cookietee helmet and boots are Iron and Gold armor look instead.

    The YAP is committed to giving you options when it comes to fashion! Each purchase comes with two choices : The first is either a hat or a set of boots, the second is either a chest piece or a set of leggings.

    The glowstone dress seems to look slightly broken until you put it on. Chalk it up to weird anomolies, yeh?

    The YAP is committed to giving you options when it comes to fashion! Each purchase comes with two choices : The first is either a hat or a set of boots, the second is either a chest piece or a set of leggings.

    The Galaxyforma outfit is a bit odd when you look at it in your bag, but it should be fiine once you put it on!

    The Glowstonetux helmet is... it doesn't really show up as anything. Invisible! Easy to work around, and it still protects your noggin, yeh!
