betterquesting:10.name:8: [I] Selling : Bath Suits and More Tanks
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
§bGoing poolside? Dress appropriately, and always nice and fashionable!

    The two bathing suits, their helms are actually odd masks. Just want to make sure you know, yeh?

    The YAP is committed to giving you options when it comes to fashion! Each purchase comes with two choices : The first is either a hat or a set of boots, the second is either a chest piece or a set of leggings.

§bHere's a goal for you, and it'll get you a bit of cash each time.

    Put together an outfit. A full one! Head, Torso, Legs, Feet.

    They don't have to be all of the same set, cause a lot of outfits are mix and match from different sets!

§aRats are smart, yes yes, and with the right upgrades, extremely useful!

    You think rat too small to chop down tree? Nonsense! This upgrade will teach rat to chop down trees! Quite helpful!

    Will only chop trees when you tell to Harvest though, so they won't chop everything down at all times, no no!

§aRats tiny, but strong! Good at sniffing out things, not just food no no!

    Mining Upgrade teaches rat to sniff out specific materials! Was once good for ores, but no longer exist, sadly! But can sniff out other materials for you!

    Just Right Click upgrade in air to set up! Then give to rat!

§aAh, fabled homeland! Though not really homeland, but dreamland! Or is real? Of course is!

    I speak of Ratlantis, yes yes! Ancient home of ancient rats, before all of our times! Spoken of quietly underground yes yes.

    Sometimes, a rat will find the gift of a Cheese Token, yes good! A great boon! They have visited nirvana and returned!

    If you can get one of these, we pay well for it! Or you can use to visit Ratlantis yourself, see the majesty!

§aScience do many things for rats! Sometimes, they do nearly magical things! but is not magic, is science of course!

    We harness Enderman ability. Give to rat to become excellent rat! Teleporting rat!

§2It definitely seems we're going to be here for a while, Bandit. It's probably best if we make good of the situation and do something more than just a spartan box for shelter, right?

    Right?!

    Here, the VanilModu got us in contact with the Emporium, a big group of traders who deal with a lot of furniture and decorations. Hey, even in the apocalypse you can have nice things, Bandit!

    Here, they want to talk to you : §r

§6-------------------
    Hmm, hmm hmm. A new merc. A pleasure! I am from the Emporium. We have many things you may be interested in!

     A nice chair to sit on in front of your computer? A desk to put the computer on! Some carpets to rest under the desk, perhaps? Some lamps to light the room? A door to let yourself in? What about that computer itself?

    See, we have many things to make this rough existance more livable. Your home is one of the big things you can control, to shape to your liking! Makes dealing with the rest of it a bit more.... palatable.

    Hmm, a test is tradition for meeting new mercenaries. I shall keep it quite minor : bring us wood, dye, clay, and stone.
-------------------§r

    §oHmm, a bit eccentric, but then again so has everyone else been. 

    Maybe I will do more than a nine by nine meter box...
No Description

§6There are many many DecoCraft items out there. And so many you can make!

    If you find many, or are retheming a room and have many spares, we shall buy them from you.

    They are not worth much each, but they are fairly plentiful to find!

§6Hmmm, would you like one of our catalogs, merc? Well, it isn't quite a catalog, but it has one built in!

    The DecoBench allows you to purchase quite a lot of the furniture and decorations we offer! You can search for specific things, or catagories, and more!

    Ah, no no. The Decobench does not accept Money, no. We're also a construction company, and the biggest thing we need is Clay and Dye. Red, Blue, and Green dye specifically, as we can make almost all the colors with just those!

    So, the DecoBench lets you put Clay and any of those three dyes into it. With enough, you can easily §mmake§r§6 purchase one of our many offerings!

    Hmm, well yes we do need money, but we have many other products you can purchase instead.

§6    Wonderful! These supplies shall definitely be put to good use.

    Now then, I've opened the showroom floor a bit to you. Please, peruse it to your leisure! If you have any questions, do not hesitate to ask, mercenary.§r

    §o"Not a bad selection, though its a bit limited..."§r§6

    Mmm yes. Some of our stock is reserved for mercenaries who help us a bit more. Some furniture is a bit more difficult to come by these days.§r

    §o"That's fair. So, how do I get access to these VIP deals?"§r

§6    Ah, I would not go as far as calling them VIP, more just... careful consideration. Hmmm, let us see. Ahh, let us go with a simple scavenge job. Bring us some chairs and tables. And hmm, perhaps some more Logs will suffice.

    You can find chairs and tables in some cities. Or you can buy them from us, we are not picky upon their source.§r

§6    Ah excellent, a good seat is always welcome. Oh, and yes, you should have acess to most of the furniture we offer. We still have some... specialist items you may be interested in though. A bit more function over form, if you may.§r

    §o"What kind of function?"§r§6

    A bit heavier duty, for one. Heavy doors, better tools, that sort of thing. We do have some special and ah... unique furniture.§r

    §o"I'd be very interested in both, I have to say."§r

§6    Of course, of course. Now lets... oh, one minute, mercenary...

    It's always something. Apologies mercenary, we just received some bad news. One of our trade caravans was attacked by Scav Raiders. When they found nothing but furniture, they apparently lit it all on fire before running off.

    How childish. Mercenary, we have a different kind of job for you this time. Please hunt down some Scav Raiders and return to us their Dog Tags. You most likely will not encounter the same ones that destroyed our merchandise, but something must be done.

§6    Thank you mercenary. We hope that will send an adequate message to any Scav Raider factions. But let us move on from grim topics.

    There is not much left that you do not have access to. The job really should reflect the usefulness... Let us see... Well, we can always use more Clay. So much construction needs it.§r

    §o"Wait, just Clay?"§r§6

    Yes, but a lot of it. Oh and perhaps more Logs as well.

§6    Fabulous work, mercenary. I know it wasn't exactly much, not unlike other Traders. But it matches what we provide, and furniture is a luxury, not a necessity for survival.§r

    §2"That's a pretty good outlook on it, I have to say."§r§6

    It may seem strange, given we are still in business against each other. But a dead mercenary cannot buy furniture, after all.§r

    §o"Well, you sell Tombstones so..."§r

§6    A bit gauche... but not untrue. Remembering fallen friends enables us to honor them by living in their stead.

    But we digress. We do not really have anything else for you. Our entire showroom floor is open to you.

    We would ask of you, however. For the fallen, would you bring us some Dog Tags? They give us the ability to lay to rest those we have lost, either to death or to evil.
No Description
No Description
No Description
No Description

§6Many of our DecoCraft items have many simple color variations. Sometimes, changing the decor of a room includes changing all the colors. And most decorations just do not match when this happens.

    But, take this DecoWand. Hold it, and Right or Left Click on one of the DecoCraft branded items. If there are alternate colors or designs for it, it'll swap through them! If not, nothing happens!

§6Plain blocks are nice for plain builds, but there is so much more variety one can have. Different arrangements, textures, and more are easy to add to a wide variety of blocks with the use of a Chisel!

    Merely Right Click this Iron Chisel in the air. You can then place various blocks into the upper left, and if you can Chisel it, the right side shall fill with a variety of options!

    Hmmm, yes, if you have a Chiseled block, you can do the same and return it to normal. I do know some things are quite picky on the material they use or accept.

    Ah yes, if you leave a block in the upper left and close the screen, you can Left Click on that block type to Chisel already placed blocks. Excellent for detailing a room, I must say!

§6Decorating a large area, mercenary? The Iron Chisel is cheap and useful, but at the obvious price of not being that durable, hmm.

    We offer a Diamond tipped Chisel that lasts quite a bit longer. It also has a few more features in it!

§6Hmmm, are you after the Top of the Line, mercenary? Of course you are!

    This is why we offer the best Chisel around : The iChisel. You will be amazed by the vast variety of new features it has! And the durability is top notch!

§6Many of these Chisel designs you can use stretch over multiple blocks. Like the giant fan ones, which is an odd choice of decoration, unless you are in a factory, then its very much welcome!

    Sometimes, this design is not set properly. It's off by a bit, usually a block or so. To fix this, use this Ender Offset Wand! Just hold and Right Click it on the block with the odd texture to 'shift' it around. You'll get the hang of it!

§6Hmmm, sometimes Chiseling blocks by hand can get tiring. Especially when you have an entire mansion's worth to decorate. Or a sprawling village. Or a large mountain base. So much to Chisel, so little time, mercenary.

    That's why we have the Auto Chisel! Supply it with power (another Trader can help you here, mercenary), one of our Chisels, and the Chiseled Block you want. Then you can put in stacks of the same material, and it will automatically Chisel them for you!

Fantastic!

§2So the Internet still exists in this world. Kind of? I mean, it's how we can contact all these Traders and stuff. But its not as big as it used to be.  

    Hey, looks like I can fabricate one of those e-displays for you. Got an image online you want to show off? Well, place one of these down, put in the link, and set up some parameters and bam, giant awesome picture of me!

    §r§o"Wait, why..."§r

    §2Oh come on, Bandit! Who wouldn't like a giant cat picture on their wall?!

§2Bandit, there are a few groups that work with the various Villages, Traders, and Mercenaries to track those who have died out in the wasteland.

    I know it seems kind of dark, but this is a pretty harsh world, and people go missing regularly. Sometimes, its good to have closure on what happened to them, yeah?

    There are three ways they track how someone has died : 

    Dog Tags are carried by many, especially Raider Scavs and Mercenaries. They will pay us for every 5 we collect and turn in.

§2Bandit, there are a few groups that work with the various Villages, Traders, and Mercenaries to track those who have died out in the wasteland.

    I know it seems kind of dark, but this is a pretty harsh world, and people go missing regularly. Sometimes, its good to have closure on what happened to them, yeah?

    There are three ways they track how someone has died : 

    While it seems quite gruesome (and it totally is, lets not fool ourselves, Bandit), the actual head from fallen humans and beastfolk are another way the fallen are tracked.

§2Bandit, there are a few groups that work with the various Villages, Traders, and Mercenaries to track those who have died out in the wasteland.

    I know it seems kind of dark, but this is a pretty harsh world, and people go missing regularly. Sometimes, its good to have closure on what happened to them, yeah?

    There are three ways they track how someone has died : 

    The last way deaths are confirmed is a bit more roundabout. One of the beastfolk trader groups has... well, as far as I can extrapolate, they have a special way of tracking what kills one creature has done.

    This group also accepts the heads of non-aggresive creatures if you can find them. They say it's to help improve their technology, but whether I believe that or not is another question.

§6Doorways can be quite simple affairs. A slab of wood, a hunk of metal for a handle, and some sort of hinge. Maybe not even that, just a cloth hanging over the entrance serves many places just fine!

    Hmmm but is there not more  you can do here? Of course there is!

    We sell a variety of fancy doors for your abode, mercenary. Some of them are quite large, like the Medievel and Carriage doors, while some of them not, like the Saloon door!

§6Doors aren't the only way to get into a room, and these can be just as fancy as our other offerings!

    The Sliding Trapdoor is a much more elegant solution than a normal trap door, and the Rusty Hatch looks rusty, but it gives your place a very vaulty kind of vibe I say!

§6Garage doors may not look all that special, but they are a great marvel. If you place a line of these down, activating one will activate all of them! Perfect for that carefully reconstructed car in your base!

§6A big stronghold requires a big door. And a heavy one to boot!

    The Reinforced Door should keep out the uncouth from your abode, while the Hi-Tech door should fit right in with your techy designs.

§6Hmmm, yes I know, sometimes the offerings of us Traders are not exactly what you are looking for, Mercenary. But a good Trader provides where they can.

    To that, we have the Door Factory. You can create custom doors with this, using your own materials, and thus create something to your own liking.

§6We offer some fairly hi-tech stuff when it comes to construction and decoration, I must say. Take this Forcefield Controller, for example!

    Right Click it on a solid block (slabs don't work quite as well I've found, something with the odd programming), then on a different block. It should create an impenetrable forcefield between the two! You can then Right Click the Controller on the field to turn it off and on!

    You can also Sneak + Right Click on a forcefield to remove it. 

    Oh and when I say impenetrable, don't mena fully impenetrable. There's bound to be things that break it. So take precautions as usual, mercenary.

§6Hmm hmmm, need a nice, low table to rest your drink on? Perhaps display some old magazines and books you've found?

    Our range of Coffee Tables should be right up your alley, mercenary!
§6Tables are so useful, and usually the centerpieces of a room. Well, they can hold the centerpieces at least. And dinner as well!
§6After a long day, are you just gonna sit on the floor when you break open that can of food? Of course not! A chair is just what you need!

§6A good kitchen needs a good fridge, right? This fridge/freezer combo is perfect and should fit right in! It can store a lot of foods and items.

    As well, the freezer can also help change a few items, as freezing does! Water turns to Ice, Lava cools into Obsidian, etc!

    You'll need Cooling Packs for this though, chilling things takes a bit of energy you know! You can easily craft some yourself, but we'll give you a couple with your purchase!

§6Wall cabinets are a good way to store and sort your goods after a trip through the wasteland.

    There's also one made specially for your Televion to sit on!

§6What's better than a nice, solid chair to sit in and relax? 

    A soft, cushiony couch of course!

    If you place two of the same color couch next to each other, they'll become one longer couch! And even longer if you put more of them! You can even create L or U shaped couch designs.

§6Table lamps are a fabulous way to light up a room. Much better than burning torch on a wall I have to say.

    If you want something a bit less modern, this Candle candlelabra should work!

§6Being able to see outside your base is all well and good, but who wants eyes peeking back in when you are trying to sleep?

    Blinds are fantastic for letting you see outside, then get a bit of privacy by Right clicking them to close them!

§6Plain, open windows are boring and drab. Curtains can really frame them in a better light, however!

    You can also close the curtains to get some privacy, which is even better.
§6Need a good place to store some clothes, reading materials, and easily lost objects that somehow find their way into your bedroom? The Bedside Cabinet has you covered.

§6No kitchen feels complete without a way to cook food. This oven is perfect, as it can cook a wide variety of foods.

    It even comes with an Oven Rangehood to catch any smoke or steam from cooking!

§6Sometimes a fence just is too harsh a view for a nice, green yard. Enter Hedges!

    These make fantastic natural fences, and can be used for such great things like mazes or blockades against zombies.

§6Hmm hmm, a green yard fence to fence is a nice thing to see in this wasteland. Breaking it up with a solid stone walkway seems out of place, so use this special Stone Path instead!

    You can also try to attract birds with the Bird Bath, or just have an easy water access with the Tap.

§6Got a community of your own going, mercenary? Or calling a local village home for a bit? Well, put up a mailbox!

    You can register it to your name, and others can deposit mail in the form on Envelopes. A couple items can even be stuffed in the envelope!

    Here, we'll even give you an envelope for free. You can easily craft them yourself too.

§6Regular fences are just so plain, you know? Sometimes you want something a bit more stylish and... well, just more! These fences give you exactly that!

    You get to choose the fence material, and also get a gate in your choice of material too!

§6Hmm hmm, I know we seem to offer mostly... decorative furniture and things. But this is a rough world, so we have to provide accordingly, mercenary.

    The Electric Fence is a fantastic defence against dangerous creatures like zombies and scav raiders. Just be careful not to touch it yourself!

§6Nothing like grilling up some food in your meticulously designed back yard with your friends, right mercenary?

    What, no grill? Well, we offer only the best!

    Right Click some Coal onto it to fill the tray, then Right Click a Flint and Steel to light the grill! You can then place Sausages, Flesh (cured from zombie flesh in a freezer!), or kebabs and let it cook!

    When it starts to smoke and sizzle, Right Click this Spatula on it to flip it and cook the other side!
§6Sometimes you just want to have fun outside. Whether its with a pool or just a bit of bouncy fun, these should help out.

§6Sitting and relaxing outdoors, with a drink in your hand, enjoying the sunset. But what are you putting that drink on, mercenary? A random crate?

    Of course not, a table is what you need! These outdoor tables are quite stylish and made easy to clean!

§6Wait, are you just sitting on a stack of boxes when in your yard? Hmm hmm that won't do at all.

    These benches should provide a nice look to your garden, park, or yard, mercenary!

§6Got a new base you need to move into, mercenary? Use these Crates, they are super handy!

    Place it down and fill it with stuff. Then hit the Seal button! Now its sealed for transport. Break it, move it, and set it back down when you are ready.

    To open it back up, Right Click this Crowbar onto it to break the seal.

    Here, since you might not need a new crowbar, you can choose either 2 crates and a crowbar, or 4 crates!

§6Need something to relax to after a hard day of salvaging, mercenary? 

    Why not tune in to TV? There isn't much left being broadcast, but you can find something on the internet (which is still up of course!) and load it up! Just make sure the file isn't too big!

    You can choose between a retro big box TV and a more modern flatscreen. Either way, you get a TV Remote which lets you control the channel with Right Click, or turning it on or off with Sneak + Right Click.

§6The internet still sort of exists today, mercenary. I mean, thats what you are talking to us through right now! It's just not as widespread or useful, unfortunately.

    You can use this Computer to access the remnants of MineBay, which a few of the Trader groups have items for sale on. 

    The Stereo has a bunch of songs built into it already for you to enjoy!

    The Printer is special. You can use it to copy Enchanted Books! The problem is that Ink is very very hard to come by! We sell some though, its just a bit expensive. And it might take multiple Ink Cartridges to copy a single book.
§6Looking to copy some Enchanted books, mercenary? Well, ink used to be expensive. It still is, really, but especially Enchanted Book Copying Ink!
§6A welcoming home needs a few things in our opinion: a nice mat to clean your shoes off, and a doorbell to announce your presence!

§6Usually your walls are good places to put things. Posters, pictures, windows... but the ceiling is good as well!

    The Fire Alarm will sound off if it detects a fire near it.

    The Ceiling Fan, Ceiling Light, and Modern Light can be turned on and off by Right Clicking them. 

    You can also turn the lights and fan on and off by using a Light Switch! Hold the Light Switch in your hand and Right Click one of them to connect it, then place the Light Switch as needed.

§6The bathroom. A place of clean, quiet introspection. Sometimes the only place one can seek solitude in a busy base.

    We offer all the necessities for a bathroom. Sinks, toilets, showers, and even mirrors!

    Though the Mirror might work somewhat oddly...

    The Washing Machine isn't technically a normal bathroom fixture, but we have it for sale. It can repair some of your armor, mostly leather stuff, if you put in Soapy Water with the armor.

§6Christmas is always a special time of year! Villages get festive, scav raiders calm down a bit, and everyone exchanges presents!

    These presents can be Right Clicked in the air to open them. Place the items you want to wrap in them, then hit the Wrap button. Now you can place the present!

    Place it somewhere like the Christmas Tree! Decorate the place with Wreaths and Fairy Lights!

§6There's a lot of kitchen gadgets you can have your kitchen! Helping with every aspect, from preparing food, cooking food, cleaning food, and more!

    The Dishwasher can repair your plain tools. It doesn't do well with non Vanilla tools, or enchanted tools. It'll need some Soapy Water to do this though!

    The Blender can be used to make a few mixed drinks. You'll need some Cups to pour the drinks into so you can, well, drink them!

    The Chopping Board is used to cut slices of Bread. Right Click the Bread onto the Chopping Board, then Right Click the Knife onto it to slice!

    Take that Bread Slice and put it into the Toaster to Toast it!

    The Microwave can cook your Potatoes or Raw Beef for you!

    Store your cookies in the Cookie Jar!

    Use Plates to serve and display food!

    The Bin can store items, and with a click of a button, disentegrate them all!

    Hmm hmm, since there are so many choices, we will let you select from two sets of items!

§6You need a good bit of space in a large kitchen. Places to prepare food, wash food, cook food. 

     Countertops are as much a decoration as as work surface, keep in mind! Not only should they look good themselves, what you put on them should look good too!

    Putting a bucket of water under the Sink will keep it nice and full for when you need it.

§6You can't store all your essential kitchen goods and food on your counters! You'd run out of space really fast!

    That's why we offer a few different Countertops with built in storage!
§6Workshops and bars make great use of these backless seats. Being able to turn easily is great for conversation or reaching things behind you.

§6Everyone needs a comfortable place to lay their head at night. Our beds are top quality!

    So much so that you'll need a Digital Clock as well so you don't oversleep!
§6We sell a variety of additions to add to any house, base, or otherwise! From windows to doors to chimneys!
§6A new age calls for new, modern designs, mercenary. This variety of couches and chairs should modernize any living room!

§6Desks are quite useful when needing to get paperwork or other office work done. Hey, just because it's a wasteland out there doesn't mean there aren't forms to fill out, right?

    These Desks and Desk Cabinets connect to each other to make any size and shape desk you want!

§6Got a picture you want displayed on your wall? Well, if you don't mind a smallish picture, upload it to the Internet somewhere, and then use this Photo Frame!

    Place the Photo Frame then Right Click it. You can then put in the URL for the photo and bam, instant memories!

§6You ever see videos before all these disasters happened? One thing that folks remember catching their fancy are those biiiig inflatable castles you always see children bouncing around in. It looked fun!

    Now, in the apocalypse, you can have your own bouncy castle, of your own design!

§6Look, sometimes you want your decor to be nice and loud and flashy. And sometimes, you want to have a cold drink with it!

    The Rave Couch is something you can make yourself easily if you know how. The Cooler can be opened and closed by Sneak + Right Clicking it with an open hand.

§6Out in the wastelands, you'll find a lot of things in old ruins, buildings, abandoned malls, and more.

    Sometimes, you'll find newer weaponry. Other times, you'll find old weapons. This can be an issue when it comes to old guns, mercenary, they tended to use very specialized ammunition.

    Hmm hmm, we keep a stock of old bullets on us. You can purchase them to use in your Old Guns.

§6There's a few things you can put outside that aren't quite garden material, but would fit in anyways!

    The anvil is self explanatory. Rename and repair items with it!

    The Trading Block lets you safely (well, fairly) trade with another Mercenary out in the field. No need to toss items to the ground at each other, or play Chest Swap Olympics!

    The Big Sign is as it says, a Big Sign!

    The Book is a placed book and quill, which you can write in and then leave. Hmm hmm this one does work better indoors, but it'd be good as a guest ledger for a hotel or a motel of sorts, right?

§6If you've set up shop somewhere, or have a base you need to broadcast to others, chances are you need a sign or a banner of some sort!

    Both of these are exactly what you are looking for! When you place one down, you can Right Click a different object on to them to 'display' that for everyone to see! Great for shops OR for saying "We got big swords, beware!" right?

    You get your choice of 2 Banners (or Wall Banners!) and 2 Signs!

§6There's such a variety of Lights and Lamps out there, mercenary. We offer many different ones, for example!

    Here we have some Tall Lamps, not so tall Lamps, Candles, and even a Campfire!
§6Variety is the spice of life, and also gives you a good seat to sit on, of course!
§6There's so many styles of couches, it makes even our heads spin! That gives you lots of choices when building your best living room though, mercenary!

§6These crates aren't as handy as the other crates, but the store a lot more! Good for store rooms and the like.

    The barrels store just as much as well, and look nicer for storing certain things, I say.

§6Got an armory? Need to display some of your best weaponry? Then use these!

    The Weapon Rack is good for displaying a variety of melee weapons nicely. Just Right Click the weapon onto a spot!

     Got a Sword you really want to show off? See if it fits in the Pedestal! Not all swords are compatable with it, however... or with the weapon rack, to be fair.

§6One of the stranger things we get sent from scavengers in the wasteland these days are these old crystal blocks. They are a pretty uniform color, partially transparent. Sort of like glass but... not?

    Hmm hmm, you might find a use for them!

§6Something we like to do when laying out floorplans is use these Placeholder blocks. They are bright and flat colored, and let us get a good sense of the space! We can then come back and replace them with something more stylish later on.

§6Such a wide variety of tables available. Though many of them are pretty simple affairs that look like each other, yeah?

    Hmm hmm, perhaps only a good interior decorator can tell the differences. Can you, mercenary?

§6Want a good spot to display your DecoCraft toy? Or perhaps that neat block you found?

    Well, use one of these Shelves! It doesn't store items inside it like some other shelves, but you can place down items on it and it looks quite fancy!

    Hmm hmm, we also have these Beams. We'll throw in some of these as well if you purchase some Shelves, okay?

§6Hey mercenary, getting your yard ready for Halloween? Then grab some of these Tombstones!

    When you place them down, you can write down whatever you want on them! Folks like to put puns and joke names on them usually. Like...

    "Why did the bike fall over? Because it was two tired!"

    Hmm... yeah, I agree with you mercenary.

§6The Emporium thrives so well because of mercenaries such as yourself traveling the wastelands and finding us furniture and resources. We refurbish the furniture, and turn the resources into MORE furniture!

    Tables are fairly popular, as its hard to get work done without them!

§6The Emporium thrives so well because of mercenaries such as yourself traveling the wastelands and finding us furniture and resources. We refurbish the furniture, and turn the resources into MORE furniture!

    Seating, whether its stools, chairs, couches, or other, is extremely in demand at all times. Who can blame folks, sitting on boxes or stone isn't comfortable!

§6The Emporium thrives so well because of mercenaries such as yourself traveling the wastelands and finding us furniture and resources. We refurbish the furniture, and turn the resources into MORE furniture!

    Mercenary, scav, villager, everyone has to eat, and a good kitchen is the best thing to work in.

§6The Emporium thrives so well because of mercenaries such as yourself traveling the wastelands and finding us furniture and resources. We refurbish the furniture, and turn the resources into MORE furniture!

    Everyone wants some sort of special storage item. Different containers makes it easier to sort things and know where it is at a glance, yeah?

§6The Emporium thrives so well because of mercenaries such as yourself traveling the wastelands and finding us furniture and resources. We refurbish the furniture, and turn the resources into MORE furniture!

    Everyone needs to be able to see. Other than some beastfolk, most of us can't see in the dark, you know!

§6The Emporium thrives so well because of mercenaries such as yourself traveling the wastelands and finding us furniture and resources. We refurbish the furniture, and turn the resources into MORE furniture!

    Bare walls and floors are fine for a strict military base, but not many of those around these days. And even those have stuff on the walls, like posters! Folks like to have curtains, door mats, chimneys, etc!

§6The Emporium thrives so well because of mercenaries such as yourself traveling the wastelands and finding us furniture and resources. We refurbish the furniture, and turn the resources into MORE furniture!

    Hedges, pathways, grills, theres so much you can put in your yard to make it look great. Folks

§6The Emporium thrives so well because of mercenaries such as yourself traveling the wastelands and finding us furniture and resources. We refurbish the furniture, and turn the resources into MORE furniture!

    Televisions, remotes, old computers. They seldom work like they used to, but just enough for us to repair and offer them to mercenaries like yourself!

§6The Emporium thrives so well because of mercenaries such as yourself traveling the wastelands and finding us furniture and resources. We refurbish the furniture, and turn the resources into MORE furniture!

    Folks gotta eat, folks gotta... well, its gotta go somewhere. And a nice, clean bathroom is a nice, quiet space in the end for folks to do their business.

§6The Emporium thrives so well because of mercenaries such as yourself traveling the wastelands and finding us furniture and resources. We refurbish the furniture, and turn the resources into MORE furniture!

    After a long day (or days!) out in the wasteland, nothing beats crashing out in your very own bed.

§6The Emporium thrives so well because of mercenaries such as yourself traveling the wastelands and finding us furniture and resources. We refurbish the furniture, and turn the resources into MORE furniture!

    You can easily find all sorts of old coins and bills in your exploration. A few eccentric mercenaries only collect these, so we purchase them from other mercenaries so you don't have to go hunting them down.

§6The Emporium thrives so well because of mercenaries such as yourself traveling the wastelands and finding us furniture and resources. We refurbish the furniture, and turn the resources into MORE furniture!

    Old sapphires, rings, and more aren't as valuable as they once were. Well, the gemstones might be, but the old rings and necklaces? We purchase them, as its a bit hard to find other mercenaries who want them, but we know a few.

§6The Emporium thrives so well because of mercenaries such as yourself traveling the wastelands and finding us furniture and resources. We refurbish the furniture, and turn the resources into MORE furniture!

    You can sometimes find old violins, horns, etc out there. While not as popular with radios and music discs still being a thing that can be found, there are those who prefer the imperfect renditions played live.

§2So there's a few Drone networks still active, right? Some of them are helpful and air drop stuff for us. Some of them we have control of ourselves.

    And then some of them are hostile and want to kill us. All of us. Or you at least, I don't know how they feel about other AI, okay?

    §r§o"That sounds... bad..."§r

    §2Well, they aren't too numerous, but they can be real deadly. I've found a quiet Trader whose offering Disruptor remotes. Every Drone (on that network) within 16 blocks will be destroyed when you use it. Good in a pinch I guess?

§6The Emporium thrives so well because of mercenaries such as yourself traveling the wastelands and finding us furniture and resources. We refurbish the furniture, and turn the resources into MORE furniture!

    With so many calamaties, the fabric of magic is pretty messed up. Sometimes its easier, sometimes its harder. A lot of magic stuff has become either inert or quite weak in power. We'll purchase all of them, as sometimes we can turn it into something else, or trade it with another Trader group for more furniture!

    Oh, those elemental and magic staves you find? Sometimes they just require a bit of Mana to use. Which is a physical pile of powder you can make yourself. We'll buy that too, really.

§6The Emporium thrives so well because of mercenaries such as yourself traveling the wastelands and finding us furniture and resources. We refurbish the furniture, and turn the resources into MORE furniture!

    Old car Keys, old broken phones, a lot of little things can be found in the wasteland. Most of the time they have almost no use other than collectors items.

§6The Emporium thrives so well because of mercenaries such as yourself traveling the wastelands and finding us furniture and resources. We refurbish the furniture, and turn the resources into MORE furniture!

    There's a wide variety of weapons out there. Some of them are kind of Odd however. No Trader sells them due to this weirdness. But we'll buy them!

    Why? Because we fix whatever is weird about them and trade them to another Trader, like the YAP for example! Sometimes they are cursed, or just badly made. Other times they just need a little refurbishing.

§6The Emporium thrives so well because of mercenaries such as yourself traveling the wastelands and finding us furniture and resources. We refurbish the furniture, and turn the resources into MORE furniture!

    There's a wide variety of weapons out there. Some of them are kind of Odd however. No Trader sells them due to this weirdness. But we'll buy them!

    Why? Because we fix whatever is weird about them and trade them to another Trader, like the YAP for example! Sometimes they are cursed, or just badly made. Other times they just need a little refurbishing.

§6The Emporium thrives so well because of mercenaries such as yourself traveling the wastelands and finding us furniture and resources. We refurbish the furniture, and turn the resources into MORE furniture!

    There's a wide variety of weapons out there. Some of them are kind of Odd however. No Trader sells them due to this weirdness. But we'll buy them!

    Why? Because we fix whatever is weird about them and trade them to another Trader, like the YAP for example! Sometimes they are cursed, or just badly made. Other times they just need a little refurbishing.

§6The Emporium thrives so well because of mercenaries such as yourself traveling the wastelands and finding us furniture and resources. We refurbish the furniture, and turn the resources into MORE furniture!

    There's a wide variety of weapons out there. Some of them are kind of Odd however. No Trader sells them due to this weirdness. But we'll buy them!

    Why? Because we fix whatever is weird about them and trade them to another Trader, like the YAP for example! Sometimes they are cursed, or just badly made. Other times they just need a little refurbishing.

§2So there's a few Drone networks still active, right? Some of them are helpful and air drop stuff for us. Some of them we have control of ourselves.

    But hey, I found a Trader online who will sell us our own simple Drone construction kit! It's nowhere near as robust or customizable as the one you can get from the Labrats, but it should prove useful.

§2Bandit, I got some details about a local mercenary group for hire.  §r

    §o"Might be useful. What's the details, Z?"§r

    §2They are pretty pricey to start a contract with, unfortunately. But you'll get a Communicator you can use to call down a couple of them to your location. They'll arrive by drop pod so it isn't useful underground or inside a building, but its better than nothing.§r

    §o"Any other catches? Is the trasnmitter only usable once or something?"§r

    §2Nah, you can use it as many times as you want, but you gotta wait between each use. They can't solve ALL your problems with bullets, Bandit.

§2Bandit, a few Mercenaries have put a call out for any Serum-B, they'll pay handsomly for them.§r

    §o"Serum-B?"§r

    §2Some of the Scav Raiders you come across will be... much larger. Much much larger. And other mercs say they hit like a truck.§r

    §o"I get it. Because of Serum-B?"§r

    §2Right! So, they'll sometimes carry leftover samples of the Serum. Get enough of them and you can make a full vial of Serum-B! And then we can sell it to these mercenaries for some money.§r

    §o"Or take it myself I guess."§r

    §2Sure sure. You'll get super buff and big. But just remember it'll be kind of like a sugar crash afterwards.

    A sugar crash on steroids turned to 11.

§2Hmm, this Global Network thing could use a bunch of improvements. I'll have to fix things up on our end to make it more user friendly...§r

    §o"Good, thanks Z."

    §2Look I have to deal with looking at this stuff too, so I might as well make it look nice. Okay, surprise surprise the world still runs off money to survive. §r

    §o"Old habits die hard I guess. How do we make money?"§r

    §2Well, it looks VanilModu has a way to turn anything into a couple of coins using the Flea Market. But the primary way things work in this world is §c§lTrading§r§2. §r

    §o"Makes sense. How do I know what's for sale and what a Trader wants?"§r

    §2Okay, each Trader page is split into two sections : Buying and Selling. Items they want to buy from you are on the Left side, the Buying section.

    Each Buying 'quest' icon is different as well, that's one of the big changes I made. So each 'Buying' icon looks kind of like a Bishop chess piece in a way. 

    Every item marked §c§lTRADEABLE§r§2 is wanted by a Trader. You might not have enough Ranks to sell the item though, so its up to you if you want to hold onto it, or turn it in for quick cash with the Flea Market.

    §o§r§o"...What the heck is the Flea Market?"§r

    §2Go talk to the VanilModu.

§2The mercenaries that offer the backup service also have a standing trade offer.§r

    §o"What for, guns? Ammo?"§r

    §2Transmitter circuit boards.§r

    §o"Come again?"§r

    §2See, they offer the Transmitter for sale. But, sometimes the merc who owns it falls in battle, and the Transmitter is looted by Scav Raiders. But, hey, they are smart, and the Transmitter doesn't like being tampered with, so it breaks on its own.§r

    §o"Wait, does that mean if I buy one, and get splatted, it'll be broken if I retrieve my stuff?"§r

    §2Nah, I'll modify it to stop that. Yours will be safe. 

    But they have a standing trade offer to buy back the Transmitter Circuit Board if you come across any.

§2Bandit, we're bound to find a trader who has some of the stuff we'll need to get out of here. The VanilModu have a lot of contacts it seems, and now we do too!

    They did give me a little warning about this Trader group though : the Heaven Plaza are very... odd. They are undead, but good ones! They just are very... eccentric in a way. 

    Where most undead are locked in a need for brains and blood, these ones are friendly, but sort of stuck in a sort of... car salesman type mode? At least the more friendly ones, by what they say.

    Why don't I just let you talk to them : §r

§4-------------------
    Ahhh, a new mercenary! I remember my first mercenary. Met them in a nice Village. They didn't realize I was a nice bonehead, tried to stab me! Hey, having visible ribs is helpful sometimes!

    He was real nice and apologetic after the Villagers explained! But hey don't worry about that, let's talk about you and us. We provide a great variety of items, top of the line! You provide cash! Or, you send us things we are looking for! And WE provide cash!

    GUARANTEED!

    You won't find some of our items anywhere else, that's for sure! So come on, mercenary, let's do a little business!
-------------------§r

    §oI... feel like I'm talking to a catalog given flesh... 

    Wait, they don't have flesh...
No Description

§4Hey there mercenary, you got a good Peat farm going, right? It's the most natural power source you can get, so of course you do!

    Got some spare Peat? Did you know you can enrich it by mixing it with some charcoal as well?

    Hey, tell ya what. If you need some cash, you could always send us some spare Enriched Peat and we'll give ya a bit of money in return.  We can always use more.

§4Are you in need of a bit of power for your base, mercenary? Of course, we all are! But there's so few options these days, no central power grid, nada. 

    But hey, that's okay, cause we got options for you! How about working with some NATURAL power?

    §lPEAT§r§4!

    Peat is a fantastic natural fuel source that you can make yourself! All you need is some Dry Peat Bog, which you can easily make by hand (or with the use of some of our other fantastic offerings!). Place it so its surrounded on most sides by water, wait a while and... bang, you got some Saturated Peat!

    Break that with a nice, strong shovel, and you get a few bars of Peat, the perfect fuel for...

    §lPeat-Fired Generator§r§4!

    This baby will take that bar of Peat and burn it to generate energy! And with Dry Peat Bog being easy to make and turn into burnable Peat,  you got a good thing going!

    But hey, if Saturating and Collecting Peat is too much work, why not get....

    §lPeat Farmer§r§4!

    Supply it with some Dry Peat Bog, some Water, and some power (and a nice biiig area! I'm talking like 8 block radius at least!), and this baby will keep you nice and supplied!
No Description
