§4Water is life, right? I mean, thats what I'm told, I'm just a bit dry here, you know? But it's okay, that means water is useful to you, and more than just for hydration! These machines we offer should be quite useful to you!

    §lFLUID COLLECTOR§r§4!

    The Fluid Collector just needs some power and some blocks, and it'll grab up liquids below it, replacing them with the block, and fill its internal tank! Good for cleaning up this little pools of death you find sometimes, right?

    §lFLUID PLACER§r§4!

    Toss in a bucket of liquid, or hey you could even pipe it in somehow, then use a Redstone Signal on the Fluid Placer to make it... hey, place fluid!

    §lSOLIDIFIER§r§4!

    Got a liquid you don't want a liquid? Like, say, you need some Ice? Use the Solidifer!

    §lHYDRATOR§r§4!

    This Hydrator does wonders! You can use it on Concrete Powder to make Concrete, encourage Moss to grow on stone, and even wash your Wool!

§4Fire! Heat! Great for giving my bonehead a nice bleached look. Though I guess if I'm not careful, might get a bit of yellowing with the pollution in some areas!

    But that's besides the point. Heat is another of those necessities humans and beastfolk need. Cooked food, warm homes, you know, the good things! What have I got for you? Well let's see...

    §lMELTER§r§4!

    Cooling items solidifies them, so heating them melts them! Place this over Lava and you can melt items efficiently! 

    §lDEHYDRATOR§r§4!

    Sometimes things get wet you don't want wet anymore. I mean, wet bones sound really uncomfortable after a while. So, the Dehydrator can help out! It can take the liquid out of items, like taking the liquid out of Rotten Flesh and turning it into Leather!

    See, even my evil brethren are good for something!

    §lFIRE STARTER§r§4!

    Need to automate starting a fire? Like, long distance igniting a Nether Portal or something! Well, the Fire Starter lets you start a fire just by supplying a Redstone Signal. You can also configure things, in case you want some special fire, or fire a certain distance, or more!

    Though you might need to replace the Flint it uses once in a while.

§4Now, I remember a time when I was a mercenary. Traveling around, digging through ruins. Sometimes I'd fine some great gear!

    And sometimes that gear would have some useless magic on it. Bane of Arthropods while I'm at the bottom of the ocean? Not that useful I have to say!

     And that's why we offer the....

    §lVOID ANVIL§r§4!

    Put your not-quite-useful magical item into the Void Anvil, and then bam, remove those Enchantments!

§4Resources are a bit scarce nowadays. Sure you can find almost anything if you search enough trash and ruins, but who wants to do that?

    Well, one thing we always have a lot of, thanks to The Nether, is Lava! Well, if you can make the trip at least.

    So with that in mind, we have available a....

    §lLAVA ANVIL§r§4!

    Pump all the Lava you can into the Anvil, then put your worn down items in! And with the power of burning heat and a bit of magic, bam you got yourself some repaired items!

§4Who wants to make a trip to the Nether just to get some Lava? Sure its really pretty in a burning death kind of way, and visiting some of my distant scorched family is nice and all, but I got better things to do here in the Overworld.

    Like offer you, my favorite mercenary, a....

    §lPOWERED DIAMOND ANVIL§r§4!

    All you need is some Energy and bam, repaired Items!

§4Now, I know its a dangerous world out there. I mean, just look at me! Hah!

    No, but really, mercenary. We carry a nice lot of things here to help you out, and that includes Armor! We have  few lines of armor you might be interested in, like...

    §lCRYSTALIZED OBSIDIAN ARMOR§r§4!

    This stuff is top top of the line! Really strong protection while you are out and about!

    And get this, each purchase comes with either a helmet or boots AND a chest piece or leggings!

§4Mercenary, we offer a good amount of things for your every day usage, and that includes tools and weapons! Like...

    §lCRYSTALIZED OBSIDIAN TOOLS§r§4!

    This stuff is top top of the line! Quite durable and able to be used on a wide variety of materials!

    As a bonus, you'll get to choose between an axe or a pickaxe AND either a Sword, Hoe, or Shovel!

§4There's a few things you could really help us out with providing, mercenary! One of them is Crystallized Obsidian.

    We make some of it in house, but we like to offer mercenaries like yourself the opportunity to make some extra cash as well!

§4Now, I know its a dangerous world out there. I mean, just look at me! Hah!

    No, but really, mercenary. We carry a nice lot of things here to help you out, and that includes Armor! We have  few lines of armor you might be interested in, like...

    §lEMERALD ARMOR§r§4!

    I know you are probably used to Diamond Armor, and that's great stuff! This, however, is much more Magic ready!

    And get this, each purchase comes with either a helmet or boots AND a chest piece or leggings!

§4Mercenary, we offer a good amount of things for your every day usage, and that includes tools and weapons! Like...

    §lEMERALD TOOLS§r§4!

    This stuff is just as good as Diamond tools, but hey, it's even better at being Magical! Great, huh?

    As a bonus, you'll get to choose between an axe or a pickaxe AND either a Sword, Hoe, or Shovel!

§4Now, I know its a dangerous world out there. I mean, just look at me! Hah!

    No, but really, mercenary. We carry a nice lot of things here to help you out, and that includes Armor! We have  few lines of armor you might be interested in, like...

    §lVISION HELMET§r§4!

    Now, this is a little better than an Iron Helmet, a bit more protection. But even better, you can Right Click it in your inventory to turn on its glowing night vision properties!

§4Hey, if I can be serious, well more serious I mean. 

    You've been a great customer, mercenary. These bones of mine are really old, and seldom few impress me like you have!

    So, I'd like to offer you the best of the best we can. And that is your choice from...

    §lTHE THREE UNBREAKABLE SWORDS§r§4!

    Yeah I know, tall words, but I ain't kidding, mercenary! These three swords do not take damage and do not break!

    To boot, each one also has a special ability when you Right Click!

    The Sword of Evasion throws an Ender Pearl.

    The Sword of Decay throws a Slowness Splash Potion.

    The Sword of Atrophy throws a Weakness Splash Potion.

§4I bet you have a lot of stuff in your base! Of course you do, you are a pretty good mercenary, you know where to search and what's good to collect, right? 

    Isn't it a pain to just move house, though? Need a new base, gotta move everything stack by stack. What a pain in the skull!

    But we can fix that! Just use...

    §lSACK OF HOLDING§r§4!

    Just hold the sack and Sneak + Right Click on a Chest, Container, or other thing to wrap it up and toss it into your inventory! Then you can Right Click the filled sack on it's new home spot to set it back out!

    Keep in mind its a one use only sack, the magic has to accomodate for some of the complex storage containers you mercenaries liek to use!

§4Ender Pearls, even after all my years of being a mercenary myself, are still sometime I like to keep in my pocket. You can't beat a quick escape when the evil side of your family comes knocking, right?

    But you can't carry a ton of them at once, and pocket space is always at a premium! So that's why we have...

    §lENDER ORBS§r§4!

    These things are Ender Pearls turned up to 11! Okay, maybe at least 8, as they DO run out, but one Ender Orb will last you a while!

    You get a choice of two versions : The Ender Orb works just like a Pearl, while the Ender Orb Translocator is special. You get to RIDE along with the Pearl after you throw it, seeing the land as you pass it by! It's great for scouting!

§4A good mercenary always has more than one way to survive. Why rely only on looted canned food when you can ALSO grow your own?

    But hey, something I've learned over the years is that managing your time is a big part of survival. And harvesting and planting can eat a lot of time, so can clearing the land!

    So to solve this, we have...

    §lSCYTHES§r§4!

    The Garden Scythe is your main tool. It lets you harvest and replant an area around you in a single swing! Just make sure you have enough seeds in your pockets!

    You also get one of these other useful scythes with your purchase : 

    The Brush Scythe clears tall grass and other things in an area. Great for gathering seeds from the grass and clearing out area for farmland!

    The Tree Scythe clears leaves out in an area! Great for chopping through dense forest and cleaning up after gathering some logs!

§4Sometimes you just need a bit of a scenery change. And what better place than in your own base? A bit of color, a change of texture, a lot can improve the mood!

    But changing things by hand is so slow! To help with that, we have...

    §lEXCHANGE SCEPTERS§r§4!

    These let you swap out already placed Blocks with ones from your inventory! Place the blocks in the upper left of your inventory, then aim one of these scepters at the blocks you want to replace!

    You can Left Click to change the size of the area, then Right Click to replace the blocks!

    You got two Scepters to choose from! The Standard scepter swaps out all blocks in the area, while the Gentle scepter only replaces the same type of block you Right Click on!

§4TNT is good at destroying things. Blocks, monsters, yourself. It'd have great utility if it was just a bit more... focused, you know? And throwable, that's important too!

    Thankfully, we have just what's needed here!

    §lDYNAMITE§r§4!

    Mining Dynamite won't hurt any creatures, even you or that pesky Creeper waddling towards you. It will break blocks, and to boot, none of the blocks will be destroyed!

    Combat Dynamite is the opposite! Throw it, and it won't break any blocks, but it WILL break any living or unliving creature caught in the explosion! Yes that includes you, mercenary, so be sure to be careful please!

    Dynamite I, while having an odd name, is a bit special. It's 1/3rd the strength of normal TNT... but if you combine two with some clay, you get more powerful Dynamite II. Then again. And again. And again. Power increasing!

§4In this time after trains and cars, a lot of us have fallen back on much more reliable (if a bit ornery) transportation : horses!

    Herds of horses wander the land still, and you can easily tame one and take care of it, and it will take care of you!

    But there's only so much you can do to improve your horse. You can improve yourself, so why not your horse?! To that, our answer is...

    §lHORSE CARROTS§r§4!

    We have a variety of special carrots that help to boost your traveling friend!

    Now, I know it's kind of weird, but the Infected Carrot will turn your horse into a Zombie Horse. Zombie Horses are a bit hardier to the harsher areas of the world.

    If you don't like that idea, and I can't blame you mercenary, you can use the Lapis Carrot to change the color of your horse's coat instead!

    But no, thse don't quite improve the horse itself, right? Use the Redstone Carrot instead! Each one you feed your horse friend will make them a little bit faster!

§4Speeding up your horse is all well and good, and it's great for getting you both out of sticky situations. But sometimes speed just doesn't cut it, right?

    So how about another round of...

    §lBETTER HORSE CARROTS§r§4!

    The Diamond Carrot can be fed to your horse, and it will boost their health up each time! Permanently!

    The Ender Carrot imbues just a little of that Enderman movement power in their hooves, and each one you feed your friendly horse will allow them to leap higher and higher!

§4Mercenary, we know how tough it is out there. A deadly world, and my evil brethren just don't make things easier. 

    Sometimes armor just isn't enough to stand up to a tough battle, what with armor piercing rounds and all that. What about being a bit healthier and able to tank the shots yourself, hey?

    That's why we offer our BEST customers the best things! Like...

    §lHEART CONTAINER§r§4!

    Each Heart Container you consume will raise your health up by... hey, a full heart! Thats TWO points, for the record! Two for the price of one!

    And you can consume up to 10 of these things, doubling your normal health levels!

    But if that's a bit too much, you can instead consume an Empty Heart Container. Which, well, takes a heart away. This includes ones you started with, so be careful!

§4Magic magic magic, not much of it exists like it used to. Too much of the fabric of magic is torn up, ya know?

    But hey, not all of it. I'm still walking around, right? Gotta be at least a bit of magic around still!

    And so that comes to our line of products you might be quite interested in...

    §lMAGIC STAVES (TIER 1)§r§4!

    Uh, don't ask why the Tier 1 is part of the title for them. I'm not allowed to change it...

    Anyways, you get two staves for the price of one here!

    The Wooden Wrench is... okay its only vaguely a magic staff. It can rotate machines and blocks around if they have different faces.

    The Rod of Elevation is kind of an escape tool. Right Clicking it into the air will teleport you upward to the nearest open air. If you are underground, that's probably the surface or another cave!

    Maybe not use it in one of the many skyscrapers. That's... probably just going to be an expensive elevator, you know?

§4Magic magic magic, not much of it exists like it used to. Too much of the fabric of magic is torn up, ya know?

    But hey, not all of it. I'm still walking around, right? Gotta be at least a bit of magic around still!

    And so that comes to our line of products you might be quite interested in...

    §lMAGIC STAVES (TIER 2)§r§4!

    The staves now get a little more useful, and you only get one per purchase! 

    The Frost Bringer launches balls of snow and ice when you aim and Right Click. They can hurt and slow creatures they hit.

    The Cavefinder is a utility staff. Right Click it on the top of a block, and it will search straight downward for the open Air of a cave, up to 32 blocks away!

§4Magic magic magic, not much of it exists like it used to. Too much of the fabric of magic is torn up, ya know?

    But hey, not all of it. I'm still walking around, right? Gotta be at least a bit of magic around still!

    And so that comes to our line of products you might be quite interested in...

    §lMAGIC STAVES (TIER 3)§r§4!

    Now we're getting into the more interesting staves!

    The Antimatter Vaporizer is a wand that has one job : obliterate liquids! You can Left Click on a block to swap between Water, Lava, and Any Liquid. Then Right Click near the liquid to vaporize it!

    The Spawner Seeker summons a special Eye of Ender that will float towards the nearest Spawner... well, if one is close enough that is.

§4Magic magic magic, not much of it exists like it used to. Too much of the fabric of magic is torn up, ya know?

    But hey, not all of it. I'm still walking around, right? Gotta be at least a bit of magic around still!

    And so that comes to our line of products you might be quite interested in...

    §lMAGIC STAVES (TIER 4)§r§4!

    Now we get to the pricey and powerful staves.

    The Evoker Fang enables you to use the power of the Evoker Illager, spawning a wave of biting jaws. Either aim at a creature, or Sneak + Right Click the ground to cast the spell.

    The Engraved Thunder is harnessed lightning. Right Click and hold to charge up a lightning ball, then release to launch it. Where it lands, lightning will strike!

§4Magic magic magic, not much of it exists like it used to. Too much of the fabric of magic is torn up, ya know?

    But hey, not all of it. I'm still walking around, right? Gotta be at least a bit of magic around still!

    And so that comes to our line of products you might be quite interested in...

    §lMAGIC STAVES (TIER 5)§r§4!

    Top of the line, just for you, mercenary!

    The Duskflame Hex launches powerful dark energy fireballs. Hold Right Click to charge them, then release Right Click to launch them. Careful, the fires they spawn can't hurt you, but the explosions can! The flames can also burn wood and vines and other things.

§4Magic magic magic, not much of it exists like it used to. Too much of the fabric of magic is torn up, ya know?

    But hey, not all of it. I'm still walking around, right? Gotta be at least a bit of magic around still!

    And so that comes to our line of products you might be quite interested in...

    §lMAGIC WANDS (TIER 1)§r§4!

    Look, the Tier being in the name isn't my choice. I'm not that boneheaded...

    The Prospector might not be as useful a tool as it would be back in my mercenary days. That was a long time ago though... anyways! Right Click it on a block face, and it'll scan a direct line of blocks through it searching for Ores. It probably won't find much but compressed trash these days, however...

    The Torch Launcher is like a magic slingshot. it loads up and fires Torches out, and places them if they hit a valid spot.

    The Spawn Detector can be Right Clicked on a block to see what kind of creatures can spawn there. Magic is a bit finicky, so it can't detect everything that might spawn... nor does it deal with Spawner or Dropper spawned creatures!

§4Magic magic magic, not much of it exists like it used to. Too much of the fabric of magic is torn up, ya know?

    But hey, not all of it. I'm still walking around, right? Gotta be at least a bit of magic around still!

    And so that comes to our line of products you might be quite interested in...

    §lMAGIC WANDS (TIER 2)§r§4!

    Still mostly utility wands this tier, but a bit more useful! 

    The Automatic Torch wand will take Torches in your inventory, and automatically place them to light up dark areas. You can toggle the wand on or off by holding it and Right Clicking.
 
    The Water Spreader can turn even the thinnest stream of water into a full size source block!

    The Water Froster, isntead of creating more water, gets rid of the problem by transforming it into Ice!

§4Magic magic magic, not much of it exists like it used to. Too much of the fabric of magic is torn up, ya know?

    But hey, not all of it. I'm still walking around, right? Gotta be at least a bit of magic around still!

    And so that comes to our line of products you might be quite interested in...

    §lMAGIC WANDS (TIER 3)§r§4!

    The wands get pretty unique and powerful now.

    The Target Dummy Spawner is a special bit of magic we've come up with. It's very EXPERIMENTAL so, use with caution! But it spawns a magic target dummy that you can test your scavenged weaponry on.

    The Player Launcher lets you put yourself in the slingshot! Hold Right Click and aim where you want to go, then release and fly! It might be dangerous to land though! You can Left Click with the wand to swap around launch modes.

    The Block Randomizer is a sneaky decorator's tool. If you have a wall of blocks, you can Right Clic this Wand on it to randomly swap them around to create new, interesting patterns! Left Click with this wand to change the size of the swap area!

§4Magic magic magic, not much of it exists like it used to. Too much of the fabric of magic is torn up, ya know?

    But hey, not all of it. I'm still walking around, right? Gotta be at least a bit of magic around still!

    And so that comes to our line of products you might be quite interested in...

    §lMAGIC WANDS (TIER 4)§r§4!

    These wands may interest you a lot, mercenary.

    The Chaos Reaper, when Right Clicked near enemies, will confuse them into attacking each other. Great for opening up an escape route!

    The Rainbow Cannon is one part wand, one part cannon, and three parts fabulous. Charge it up with some energy, like in our Battery, then it can be Right Clicked to fire off randomly colored beams of energy!

    The Cyclic Building Sceptor is our long range building tool you might like, mercenary. Not only can it place blocks down up to 63 blocks away, it can also store the blocks you are using!

    Sneak + Scroll Wheel to swap between the different modes. The Chest will open up the inventory, while the other modes will change how the block will be placed down, from above, in front of, beside, etc!

§4Magic magic magic, not much of it exists like it used to. Too much of the fabric of magic is torn up, ya know?

    But hey, not all of it. I'm still walking around, right? Gotta be at least a bit of magic around still!

    And so that comes to our line of products you might be quite interested in...

    §lMAGIC WANDS (TIER 5)§r§4!

    Only the best for the best mercenary!

    The Spirit Seeker is quite simple. It launches magic homing missles that fly at the nearest enemy. Simple, no?

§4Slimes, you know those squishy things you see sometimes? Bounce around, attempt to squish you (or just butt against you if its too small, all adorable like?)? Well, we think that bouncing is cute, so we have a product to mimic it! Introducing...

    §lSLIME PLATES§r§4!

    You can place these and then you can jump onto them, run onto them, whatever, and they'll fling you into the air! You'll even get a bit of a Bouncy magic boost so you don't splat on the ground afterwards!

    You can choose from 4 different Slime Plate strengths! 

    And hey, it's not just you who can bounce! Other creatures can! So can things like minecarts, or dropped items! Imagine what you can do with them!

§4Sometimes you gotta move it. Move it? Yeah, move it!

    If you got some kind of little makeshift factory going on, or an animal farm, you might find some use out of...

    §lCONVEYOR BELTS§r§4!

    These things will move dropped items, creatures, and you around as you need!

    You have three Conveyor Belt pieces : straight line, turn, and ramp. To rotate them around, you'll need some kind of Wrench (check out our Tier 1 staves, by the way!)

    This first tier of Conveyor Belts we offer are the slowest, but also the cheapest!

§4Sometimes you gotta move it. Move it? Yeah, move it!

    If you got some kind of little makeshift factory going on, or an animal farm, you might find some use out of...

    §lCONVEYOR BELTS§r§4!

    These things will move dropped items, creatures, and you around as you need!

    You have three Conveyor Belt pieces : straight line, turn, and ramp. To rotate them around, you'll need some kind of Wrench (check out our Tier 1 staves, by the way!)

    This second tier of Conveyor Belts we offer are are a bit faster, and only cost a tiny bit more!

§4Sometimes you gotta move it. Move it? Yeah, move it!

    If you got some kind of little makeshift factory going on, or an animal farm, you might find some use out of...

    §lCONVEYOR BELTS§r§4!

    These things will move dropped items, creatures, and you around as you need!

    You have three Conveyor Belt pieces : straight line, turn, and ramp. To rotate them around, you'll need some kind of Wrench (check out our Tier 1 staves, by the way!)

    This third tier of Conveyor Belts we offer go at a moderate pace, not too fast, not too slow!

§4Sometimes you gotta move it. Move it? Yeah, move it!

    If you got some kind of little makeshift factory going on, or an animal farm, you might find some use out of...

    §lCONVEYOR BELTS§r§4!

    These things will move dropped items, creatures, and you around as you need!

    You have three Conveyor Belt pieces : straight line, turn, and ramp. To rotate them around, you'll need some kind of Wrench (check out our Tier 1 staves, by the way!)

    This fourth tier of Conveyor Belts are the fastest we offer! Zoom!

§4I know cables are all the rage. Or were. Again? I don't know, they seem to come and go every few years.

    But for me, nothing will be as good as...

    §lWIRELESS REDSTONE§r§4!

    The Wireless Redstone Transmitter and Receiver are a pair of blocks you can use to transmit Redstone Signals across distances, without using wires!

     First, place down a Receiver, then Left Click a Transmitter onto it to record the location. Then place the Transmitter down whever you want it to be.

    Now, when you put a Redstone Signal to the Transmitter, the Receiver will copy it to any adjacent blocks, wires, what have you!

§4Turrets are all well and good for base defense, but such a hassle. Gotta supply power, gotta supply ammo, sometimes you just don't got the time for either, right?

    Well, we have the solution to that!

    §lIRON SPIKES§r§4!

    These things have been used for hundreds of years to protect all sorts of things. So how can we improve them, mercenary?

    Well, by making it so they are ONLY active when a Redstone Signal is applied! Safety, mercenary!

§4Turrets are all well and good for base defense, but such a hassle. Gotta supply power, gotta supply ammo, sometimes you just don't got the time for either, right?

    Well, we have the solution to that!

    §lDIAMOND SPIKES§r§4!

    I know I know, we offered Iron Spikes with the ultimate Safety improvement. But we found another way to improve them!

    See, normal Iron Spikes have a bad habit of puncturing items as well as creatures. That's not good!

    So, with a bit of material alterations and design tweaks, Diamond Spikes work much better in the not-destroying-items department!

§4Why stop at making just Redstone wireless? Why not make all of it wireless?

    Without so many folks around, the wireless bands aren't as clogged as they used to be. Though I do wish they were a bit more clogged, I'm not that boneheaded. Anyways!

    What I'm talking about is...

    §lWIRELESS TRANFER NODES§r§4!

    You can transfer either Energy, Fluids, or Items!

    To do so, you'll also need these GPS Marker. After you've placed your Nodes down, Right Click a GPS Marker onto the Node to record the location. 

    Then share the location of the nodes with each other to create a Transfer Network. You can then just the Nodes as you see fit, then Pipe, Cable, or whatever the appropriate things into the Nodes!

     You can purchase either 6 Energy, 4 Liquid, or 2 Item. You'll also get a few GPS Markers with your purchase!

§4I know, every big Trader group has their own cable system these days. Okay not every Trader group, but a few!

    But hey, each one is a bit different, and have different strengths! Like ours...

    §lCABLES AND PIPES§r§4!

    So we have three... no, wait, four! Four different 'cables'! Well, one of them is a pipe, cause it's for fluid, but still!

    Item Cables transport Items. Fluid Pipes transport Fluids. Energy Cables transport Energy. And Bundled Cables can transport all three!

    But how do you get these INTO the cables? Well, you use Extraction Cables/Pipes! Sneak + Right Click an Extraction Cable/Pipe onto the inventory, tank, or battery you want to extract from, then hook up all the cables as you need!

    Need to rotate an extraction point? Or disable a side on it? Or disconnect two cables/pipes? Use a Wrench (See our Tier 1 Staves for an example!) or a Redstone Torch to configure your cables/pipes as you need!

    Also included in your choices is an Item Sorter! You can connect Pipes, Cables, or Hoppers to sides, and then Right Click them and configure what each side outputs!

    Hey, each purchase, you get to choose an Extraction cable and some cables/pipes! Or you can replace either with some Item Sorters!

§4I know space is at a premium for mercenaries. You can only have so many chests before your base might as well be MADE of chests, right?

    One thing taking up a lot of room in many bases is Enchanted Books. They don't really stack, they need their own little bit of space, right?

    Well, to that we've come up with the...

    §lENDER LIBRARY§r§4!

    Now you can store all those Enchanted Books in one Library!

    First you'll need the Ender Library Block, then you'll need to surround it with as many Ender Shelves as you want!

    Each shelf has multiple spots to hold Enchantments. One Enchantment per spot, but that spot can hold lots of that enchantment! Just Right Click an Enchanted Book onto the Shelf, and it'll pull out and store the Enchantment, and give you a blank Book!

    Need an Enchantment back? Right Click a Book on the Enchantment spot you want!

    You can even automate this library by piping in Enchanted Books, and piping out blank Books!

§4Signs, so versatile, so long lasting. Heck, I remember when some signs to local villages first went up ages ago. They are still there too! Just kinda worn down, like my boneheaded self! Anyways!

    Signs are also a bit of a pain as it isn't easy to just edit or copy them. Well, you can edit them, but you can't make em FANCY easily! Or copy them easily!

    So, to that, we have...

    §lRAINBOW CRAYONS AND CARBON PAPER§r§4!

    The Rainbow Crayon lets you edit signs... with a twist! You can set each line's color, or make it underlined, or even do that crazy mysterious Corrupted text!

    Carbon Paper lets you Sneak + Right Click it on a sign to copy it, even the stylized one from Rainbow Crayons! It won't work well if the sign is slapped onto a Chest, though, be careful.

    To clean off a piece of Carbon Paper, just craft it alone!

    Okay okay, so you can make your own Carbon Paper preeeettty easily, but we'll include some just for purchasing the Rainbow Crayon!

§4We offer all sorts of little tools and helpful items to mercenaries such as yourself, specifically to help with the various Villagers around. Heck, a lot of these I wish I had when I was in my merc days! I might not be as boneheaded, hey!

    Anyways, here's a few things I can offer you!

    §lMERCHANT ALMANAC§r§4!

    This handy little thing is like a tiny Survival Guide (the thing we're talking through!), but it talks specifically with the nearest Villager, and shows off what they have for trade! No need to go back and forth and talk about each trade one by one!

    But what if the Villager is being stingy about trades? Then you might like the...

    §lEMERALD APPLE§r§4!

    Use this to a Villager, and they should be right and happy to trade you everything again! 

    Don't got any villagers around cause they got eaten and turned into zombies? Well, use this on the zombie villager to turn them back into a villager! Fight back against my evil brethren!

§4Now, we both know survival in this world is one part luck, four parts planning, and 10 parts tenacity. That last part is all on you, mercenary.

    But for planning? Yeah we got some tools you might like : 

    §lENDER BOOK§r§4!

    The Ender Book enables you to 'record' your current location into it. Then you can spend some of your magical Experience points to teleport back to that location at any time!

    The farther you want to travel, the more it costs. And the Experience cost is pretty... steep. You'll have better costs using the Waystones, mercenary, but this is good in an emergency!

    §lSOULSTONE§r§4!

    Going into a very rough fight, you prepare well in advance. That includes contingencies in case you die!

    The Soulstone will prevent you from dieing ONCE if it is in  your inventory. You'll pop back up, healed slightly, buffed a bit, but weakened from the experience.

§4We have such a variety of tools available to good mercenaries like yourself. 

    §lENHANCED SHEARS§r§4!

    Well, how do you improve a pair of Shears, other than making them more durable?

    How about magic throwable shears?!

    §lMATTOCK§r§4!

    A pretty durable tool, this is. Great as both a Pickaxe and a Shovel, and it works through a 3x3 area!

betterquesting:10.name:8: [I] Selling : A Tool For This And That
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
§4Tools tools make the world go around... well, they help make the things that make the world go around, yeah?

    We got lots of different things you might be interested in, mercenary! Like...

    §lOBSIDIAN SHEERS§r§4!

    Normal Iron Shears not durable enough? Try these!

    §lPISTON SCEPTOR§r§4!

    A great tool, that turns YOU in the piston! You can push, pull, and rotate blocks, including things like chests and machines!

    §lSLEEPING MAT§r§4!

    Out on a long scavenging run and don't want to lose your prime respawn location by sleeping the night away?

    The Sleeping Mat can be used to get a good nights rest with or without setting a respawn point!

    §lREMOTE LEVER§r§4!

    Walking all the way across your base can get boring when all you want to do is flip the lever for the lights, right? Well, use the Remote Lever!

    Sneak + Right Click it onto any Lever to bind it, then you can Right Click the Remote Lever anywhere, to toggle the actual Lever!

    §lFIRE SLAYER§r§4!

    Look, it's just a Fire Extinguisher with a rad name. Puts out fires around you when you use it. Pretty simple!

§4Endermen and their eyes are such mysteries, even to this day. Are they responsible for any of the calamaties? Did they have their own calamaties? What exactly do they see with their special eyes?

    We may never know, but what we do know is their Ender powers enable a lot of neat magic things : 

    §lSOLID ENDER EYE§r§4!

    This is an especially magic version of the Ender Eye. Usually you have to use multiple Ender Eyes to locate a Stronghold(usually from losing a couple in the search!), but this one is easily reusable!

    §lENDER SACK§r§4!

    Access your Ender Chest from anywhere!

    §lENDER WING§r§4!

    This tool will enable you to teleport directly back to the world's Origin, or spawn point.

    §lENDER WING PRIME§r§4!

    An alternate to the Ender Wing, this version teleports you to your own spawn point, usually the last bed you slept in!

§4Sometimes in life (and in unlife!) you just have to grab opportunity when it shows up!

    That's why we have these tools for you!

    §lSTIRRUPS§r§4!

    Riding horses and pigs  are all well and good, but there's lots of other animals out there you can ride! The Stirrups let you ride on any creature out there. Piggy back rides for everyone!

    The Inverted Stirrups, though, let you put another creature on your head and carry them around! Great for collecting those errant cows that escaped your farm for the tenth time, right?

    §lCLIMBING GLOVES§r§4!

    This world has so many tall, abandoned buildings. Who wouldn't want to climb them?! With these gloves, you can climb any vertical surface!

    §lBOOMERANG§r§4!

    There's a tale as old as time... well, okay, maybe not that old, but it was an old tale when I was a mercenary! Of a mercenary in green who loved using a bow, a sword, and... a Boomerang! 

    Hold Right Click to power up your throw, then release to launch! This Boomerang can hit enemies at range and stun them, and also pick up items they've dropped and bring them back to you!

§4Even back when I was a mercenary, magic was a weird thing. It's only gotten stranger over time!

    These fruits here are a good example. Their effects are kind of odd, but pretty useful!

    §lLAPIS APPLE§r§4!

    Sometimes, in the dead of night, when the stars align, a neighing groan can be heard. It is, the zombie horse! In all my decades, I've only encountered one out in the wild!

    You cannot tame the Zombie Horse by normal apples. You'll need this special Lapis apple!

    §lAPPLE OF LOFTY STATURE§r§4!

    This is an interesting one. Normally you just... step up onto a single higher block, right? What if you didn't? Or wanted to again? Eat this apple!

    Then eat it again if you want to go back to how it was before. It's why we sell you TWO of them at once!

    §lGLOWING CHORUS FRUIT§r§4!

    Sometimes when you are building, you just need to be able to fly, right? Or to get out of a really bad zombie party, I guess.

    Eating a Glowing Chorus Fruit will let you creatively fly around for a couple minutes. Keep an eye on that timer though, once it runs out you are basically a falling rock again!

    The great thing is you can eat a few of these in a row and the flight time stacks up!

    §lCORRUPTED CHORUS FRUIT§r§4!

    This fruit sort of... phases you out of reality. Just for a few seconds! But those few seconds lets you phase through walls!

    Just... be careful where you phase, right? The magic makes sure you don't just materialize in solid rock. But if you successfully phase back in, you'll be a bit disoriented, so... yeah like I said, be careful mercenary!

§4Sometimes, leading an animal around by a leash just won't cut it. Especially when you have three of them you need to get back home!

    Plus, who knows what'll happen along the way? Scav Raiders like taking any opportunity to jump mercenaries, and dealing with angry bovine is a great opening I'd say.

    Worry not though, because we offer...

    §lMONSTER BALL§r§4!

    Just take this spherical, non infringing ball of technology, and Right Click it to throw it! If it hits a creature, it'll capture it!

    You can then Right Click the ball to throw it again and release the creature! Just be careful where you throw the ball if you want to be able to use it again.

§4Magic baubles are perhaps the most stable bit of magic that has survived disaster after disaster. These little charms are quite useful for mercenaries! They'll slowly wear down as they get used, but they are worth every penny!

    Just turn one of these charms on by holding and Right Clicking it, then place it in any Bauble slot to benefit! (click the grey ring in your inventory next to your portrait!)

    §4§lANTIDOTE CHARM§r§4!

    This charm will automatically cure you of Poison and Wither!

    §4§lSAILOR CHARM§r§4!

    Boat travel a bit too slow? While you wear this, your boats will go super fast!

§4Magic baubles are perhaps the most stable bit of magic that has survived disaster after disaster. These little charms are quite useful for mercenaries! They'll slowly wear down as they get used, but they are worth every penny!

    Just turn one of these charms on by holding and Right Clicking it, then place it in any Bauble slot to benefit! (click the grey ring in your inventory next to your portrait!)

    §4§lWATER CHARM§r§4!

    This charm will prevent you from drowning!

    §4§lFIRE CHARM§r§4!

    This charm prevents you from taking fire damage!

    §4§lVOID CHARM§r§4!

    Sometimes, little holes in the bedrock lead to The Void. Places like The End are nothing but Islands over the Void!

    This charm prevents you from dieing if you happen to fall into The Void!

§4Magic baubles are perhaps the most stable bit of magic that has survived disaster after disaster. These little charms are quite useful for mercenaries! They'll slowly wear down as they get used, but they are worth every penny!

    Just turn one of these charms on by holding and Right Clicking it, then place it in any Bauble slot to benefit! (click the grey ring in your inventory next to your portrait!)

    §4§lAIR CHARM§r§4!

    This charm lets you walk off a ledge, and just keep going like you were walking on an invisible bridge! You can sink back downward by sneaking.

    §4§lWING CHARM§r§4!

    Abandoned cities have lots of vertical space, and can be quite dangerous to traverse the rooftops! This charm lets you parkour safely around, as if you fall far enough, it'll kick in with a bit of Safe Fall magic!

    §4§lSPEED CHARM§r§4!

    Not moving fast enough? This charm will boost not only your speed, but the speed of the horse you are riding too!

§4Sometimes, I miss TV, you know? Not sure if you know what that is, younger mercenaries don't remember it quite like I do. I'm just boneheaded though and looking through rose tinted goggles... Anyways!

    There's a lot of neat things you can display on TVs, screens, and more. You might be interested in some of these!

    §lMOON PHASE SENSOR§r§4!

    The Daylight Sensor emits a Redstone Signal when its daytime, right? Well, the Moon Phase sensor emits a Redstone Signal depending on the phase of the moon!

    §lTEXT PROJECTOR§r§4!

    This is like a futuristic Sign! You can write and customize text on it, and it gets displayed like a hologram! You can change how far away it projects the text too!

    §lSENSOR DISPLAY§r§4!

    You can use this screen to get information on a distant block! Just Sneak + Right Click a GPS Marker on that block, then put the GPS Marker into the Sensor Display!

    §lEMPTY BEACON§r§4!

    Like the great look of the magical Beacon but don't like the immense cost? Use this Empty Beacon instead! Just provide a Redstone Signal to it!

    §lLASER CELL§r§4!

    The Laser Cell can create an awesome laser show! Just provide it with a few GPS Markers with locations set, configure the lasers, and let it go!

    So, with a purchase of any of these items, you can also get a few GPS Markers! Or you can get a Doorbell. One of the two!

§4There's so many useful things for your base or household, mercenary. We come across new things, and old new things, and new old things, quite regularly!

    Do any of these interest you, by chance?

    §lFLUID STORAGE TANK§r§4!

    This single tank can store 64 BUCKETS worth of a single fluid!

    §lSOUNDPROOFING§r§4!

    Your area a bit too noisy? Need peace and quiet in your bedroom? Don't we all... so thats why we use this Soundproofing! It reduces all the sounds within 6 blocks of this block. Just a couple can make your sleeping quarters nice and peaceful!

    §lSFX BLOCK§r§4!

    Conversely, if you want to MAKE more sounds, this SFX Block is just what you need! It can replicate almost any sound or music that isn't on a music disc! Just be careful, you can get really cacophonous with long sounds...

    §lDICE§r§4!

    Need to make a decision but all of them are good? Try using Dice! When you place this down, or Right Click it when it's already placed, will 'rotate' it around to a random face!

    §lTRASH VOID§r§4!

    I mean, I'm not sure why you'd use this when the Flea Market exists. You can find someone who will buy anything on that!

    But if you REALLY need to destroy something, throw or pipe it into this Trash Void Can!

§4A big thing with mercenary work we like to help with is Automating things. You only have so many hours, and so many helpers, that to survive you need to be smart about things!

    So thats why we have a whole range of automation items you might be interested in!

    §lAUTOMATIC FISHING NET§r§4!

    Place this in water, give it a Fishing Rod and some power, and just sit back and relax while it sits back and fishes for you!

    §lSHEARING BLOCK§r§4!

    Got a flock of sheep? Place this block somewhere in the pen, and each time a Sheep brushes against it, it'll automatically be sheered! You'll still have to collect the wool yourself, but we can help with that, too!

    §lBLOCK PLACER§r§4!

    Toss some blocks into this machine, and rotate it around with a Wrench (see Magic Staves I for our own special wrench!), and when you supply a Redstone Signal Pulse to the Block Placer, it... places the block! 

    §lSPRINKLER§r§4!

    Got a farm going? Well, place this over some Water, and it'll automatically hydrate AND encourage your crops to grow faster!

§4A big thing with mercenary work we like to help with is Automating things. You only have so many hours, and so many helpers, that to survive you need to be smart about things!

    So thats why we have a whole range of automation items you might be interested in!

    §lAUTO CRAFTER§r§4!

    With this, you can automatically craft some things, usually construction materials! Just set the recipe, give it some power, and the ingredients, and it'll automatically craft them for you!

    §lPACKAGER§r§4!

    An alternate to the Auto Crafter, this machine automatically packages up some items into blocks, like Ingots into Blocks for example! Just supply the ingredients and some power!

    §lAUTOMATED USER§r§4!

    There are plenty of tools, gadgets, and whatnot that have a Right Click function to them. And sometimes, doing that yourself is boring! Why not automate it with the Automated User!

    Not everything works with it, but you can configure how it works pretty easily!

§4A big thing with mercenary work we like to help with is Automating things. You only have so many hours, and so many helpers, that to survive you need to be smart about things!

    So thats why we have a whole range of automation items you might be interested in!

    §lFORESTER§r§4!

    This machine will plant saplings you give it, and harvest logs for you! It requires to do so, but you can also power it with a bit of Coal!

    §lHARVESTER§r§4!

    Face this machine towards your crops, and it will automatically harvest then, and replant seeds when it can! The crops will drop onto the ground, so you'll need another machine to pick them up, like the...

    §lITEM COLLECTOR§r§4!

    You can define an area around this machine for it to automatically search and pick up items! You can even tell it what items it should or should not pick up!

    §lBLOCK MINER§r§4!

    Aim this machine at a block using a Wrench (Like our handy dandy one in Magical Staves I!). Then supply a Redstone Signal and it will mine it!

§4A big thing with mercenary work we like to help with is Automating things. You only have so many hours, and so many helpers, that to survive you need to be smart about things!

    So thats why we have a whole range of automation items you might be interested in!

    §lCONTROLLED MINER§r§4!

    An advanced version of the Block Miner. Lots of improvements, like setting an area, telling it what tool to use, what blocks to mine... or not mine for that matter!

    §lSTRUCTURE BUILDER§r§4!

    Sometimes, building another base by hand is just so boring! You can use this machine to designate an area, and a general shape or structure design, then feed it some resources and power and there you go, quick building!

§4A big thing with mercenary work we like to help with is Automating things. You only have so many hours, and so many helpers, that to survive you need to be smart about things!

    So thats why we have a whole range of automation items you might be interested in!

    §lUNCRAFTING GRINDER§r§4!

    Now, this block is probably not that useful nowadays, especially not after the last calamaty. But hey, you might be able to use it to break down some blocks or machines into other ingredients. 

    Though I don't know if you'll be able to break down much, just a fair warning!

    §lPATTERN REPLICATOR§r§4!

    Now this is a very advanced version of the Structure Builder! With it, you can copy a structure you've built, then have this machine rebuild it somewhere else! You just need to supply it the proper materials!

§4Getting yourself around is easy. Getting other things around? Well, that's sometimes a bit more tricky, isn't it?

    Here's a few things that might help you out then, mercenary!

    §lAERIAL FAITH PLATE§r§4!

    This highly configurable plate can launch you or other creatures how you want! Good for getting around a complex (highly defendable!) base, or for any other reason!

    §lFAN§r§4!

    Supply this with a Redstone Signal, and the Fan will push all creatures and dropped items in front of it away, around 16 blocks away!

    §lPRECISE DROPPER§r§4!

    A Dropper is fairly useful, but fairly... random. With this upgraded Precise Dropper, you have a whole lot more control!

§4Redstone is still the primary signal source these days. Redstone is easily salvagable from tech, new and old, and can be repurposed any number of ways!

    Sometimes the Redstone gadgets we have can be put to many different uses!

    §lREDSTONE CLOCK§r§4!

    Now, with enough space and use of some simple Redstone Repeaters and Torches and whatnot, you can make a very servicable clock circuit... or  you can use this Redstone Clock! Highly configurable, and confined to the space of a single block! How useful!

    §lPASSWORD TRIGGER§r§4!

    Now this is a nifty little block. It's sort of like the Wireless Redstone Transmitter, except not. Instead, it listens to your local chat waves, and when it sees the Password you configured, it will delete that message and activate, sending out a Redstone Signal!

    You can configure it so it only activates on YOUR messages, for added security!

    §lBULLSEYE TARGET§r§4!

    Now this is a great way to practice your bow skills, mercenary. Each time an arrow hits the target on the side, it will send out a Redstone Signal, with the strength dependant on how close to the Bullseye you got!

    §lENTITY DETECTOR§r§4!

    This detector scans the area for creatures, living and unliving, sending out a Redstone Signal when the limit has been crossed. You can configure how many entities will set it off, the signal strength, and more!

§4Now, we provide a couple ways to generate power. That's FE units usually, right? Well, most machines can only hold so much energy in them, and the excess just kinda goes to waste, or the machine just sits there, waiting to generate more power.

    But a good power system needs a way to store a lot more Power, right? So, you'll need...

    §lBATTERY§r§4!

    This Battery block can hold a whole lot of energy! It can even charge up powered items if you put them in the slot!

§4Beacons are magical, fantastic devices. Place it down, build a monument under it, and it enhances every mercenary nearby.

    But there is a more powerful Beacon, and only we have!! And since you are the most loyal customer to us, mercenary, we offer it for sale to you!

    §4§lPHAROS BEACON§r§4!

    This Beacon, instead of needing a monument to power it, with a limited selection of enhancements, will take the Potions you put into it, and apply them to everyone in the area!

    You can configure it to only effect mercenaries, creatures, monsters, or EVERYTHING!

§4Enchanting items takes a lot of work. You have to gather Experience, and Lapis, and then work your puzzle solving skills in an Enchanting Table.

    I mean, there's also just slapping books on items, but those are a bit harder to come by!

    So, we have some items in this area you may be quite interested in!

    §lEXPERIENCE PYLON§r§4!

    It's quite annoying when you are out hunting Scav Raiders and Zombies, building up your Experience, only to get one shot by a serum'd up giant Brute, and see all that good glowy Experience vanish.

    Well, with the Experience Pylon, you can fill it with your Experience between hunts, as well as let it gather all Experience Orbs in the area! You can then bottle it up with a Glass Bottle, or pipe the Experience out as a liquid!

    §lPOWERED ENCHANTER§r§4!

    You can take that liquid Experience and pipe it into this Powered Enchanter! Add some Power, and put in items, and it'll automatically enchant them!

    The enchants are random, keep in mind! If you want more control, Enchant the normal way, or use Enchanted books!

    §lIMBUE STATION§r§4!

    Bows are a bit more special to enchant. Using the Imbue Station lets you power up your normal Bows to your liking! You can see what you can add to a bow with Sneak + Right Clicking on the Imbue Station!

    §lUNCHANT PYLON§r§4!

    Got a bunch of Enchanted gear with some enchants you don't want? Or Enchants you'd like to put on something better? Use the Unchant Pylon!

    It requires both Power and a few Reagents, as well as some Books, to function. But it will strip a random Enchant off the item you put into it, and place it into a Book.

§4Mercenary, since you've been so good to us, we offer some of our best items : 

    §4§lITEM MAGNET§r§4!

    This magic imbued plate will teleport all dropped items and experience orbs to it. And I mean all of them. 

    §4§lINTERDICTION PULSAR§r§4!

    This magical device repels all enemies that get close to it every few seconds.

§4While it seems counterproductive, sometimes you need to attract the wrong kind of attention.

    For that, we have a...

    §lWATER CANDLE§r§4!

    With this out, it will attract more dangerous creatures to show up nearby much more often.

    You've been warned. Make sure you are ready, mercenary!

§4Since the fabric of magic has been twisted, some weird things have popped up over time.

    And nature magic especially has been twisted mercenary. Just look at this!

    §lMAGIC BEANS§r§4!

    These beans can be grown like any normal crop. But what you harvest?

    Well, that's the magic, I guess. You don't get edible beans back... usually. You could get some flowers! Or a bush! Or an Iron Ingot! Or a coin!

§2I have to say, this place is more paranoid than that merc enclave we hung out at for a while. Remember that?

    §r§o"I mean, they had good reason. But what do you mean?"§r

    §2So... you may have noticed already, but most every chest you find in the world? It's got a lock on it. And since so much of it is abandoned, where do you think the keys are?

    §r§o"....I see."§r

    §2Okay so, thankfully it looks like your multimeter turned into a stack of Lockpicks. Right Click them onto a chest to try picking it. You need to use A and D to move the pick back and forth, and W to try the pin.

     You need to figure out the correct order to set the pins. Each time you fail, progress resets and you might break your pick.

    §r§o"Wow, going old school I see."§r

    §2No kidding. I swear of a sweet roll is in one of these... but anyways. You can then Sneak + Right Click the chest with an empty hand to remove the Lock and use it later. But you'll want to set a Blank Key to it, unless you REALLY like picking locks.

    Take a Blank Key and craft it with the Lock. Now that Key will unlock that Lock when it is on a Chest.

    Oh, there's also a Keyring you can place your keys on.

§2I got in contact with a few Villages who want to purchase Locks.§r

    §o"Just Locks? Not Keys?"§r

    §2Nope, just Locks.§r

    §o"Why?"§r

    §2They apparently have a Master Key that unlocks any lock. But braving the Scav Raiders and undead are kinda not worth it for just some Locks. Not when they can pay YOU for them!§r

    §o"Of course..."§r

    §2So yeah. Go get some Locks. I mean, you'll find them anyways, right? Might as well make a few bucks.

§2Bandit, I know you miss your vein mining tools.

    §r§o"Mostly for the trees. There isn't much ore around here unfortunately."§r

    §2True, but I think I got a line on some useful stuff for you, which might be a little better than your old Vein Mine trick!

    §r§o"How so?"§r

    §2Okay so, a few Traders have access to a bit of stable magic. Juuust enough to create what is called an Excavation Enchant. You can put the enchant on anything (with an Anvil of course!) and it'll mine extra blocks as long as you are Sneaking.

    §r§o"Ah, just like Vein Mining. Sneaking while breaking a block breaks the vein. Or the tree."§r

    §2Or whatever else! Thats one of the differences, this lets you mine stone and stuff too with it! It'll eat through your tool durability though. And your hunger...

    §r§o"Okay so what's the catch?"§r

    §2Well, the Enchants cost money. There's also FIVE tiers of enchant! You'll have to combine lower level books in an Anvil to get a higher tier. 

    You can also Modify your Tinker's Tools using the Modifier. Five modifier levels equals one Enchant level... I think?

§2Got your cooking skills up to snuff, Bandit?§r

    §o"Why?"

    §2Looks like food in this world isn't as... saturating as it is in Minecraftia. You'll have to track both your food AND your water intake a lot more closely. §r

    §o"Oh. I try to do that anyways."

    §2Yeah yeah, but reminding you about things is my job. Well, one of my jobs. So drink things when you can. Heck, even potions will hydrate you some. Tea, coffee, soda, etc. 

    Some things that SHOULD hydrate you might not, though, so be careful!

§2The VanilModu let me know about two types of bounties that we should be aware of as new Mercenaries.§r

    §o"Bounties huh? I guess we ARE considered mercenaries afterall."

    §2Yep. Okay, the first one is simple. There are Bounty Boards in Villages, or you can make one. They'll automatically fill in with requests from locals, and you fulfill them and get paid in return. §r

    §o"Uh... what if my base is out in the boonies?§r"

    §2You'd be surprised where folks can settle down, especially in secret. Don't worry about it.§r

    §o"If you say so. What's the other bounty?§r"

    §2Okay, the big abandoned cities are giant breeding grounds for both monsters and large Scav Raider gangs. The Trader network has pooled together money for Mercenaries who go in and clear out buildings.

    I've activated a scanner in the Survival Guide. If a building is marked with a Bounty, I'll let you know. Wander the floors and fight all the monsters and Scavs you find, but be careful, as they get pretty strong. Call it a home field advantage.§r

    §o"What about anything I find in the building?§r"

    §2Yours as part of the payment, but I suggest bringing lots of Lockpicks.

    Clear out the building and you'll get a stack of cash as a reward.

§2Sorry for talking your ear off, Bandit, but this is both of our survival we're talking about here, yeah?§r

    §o"I know I know, it's good stuff to know. What now?"§r

    §2Well, first thing's first, we need to get in good with the VanilModu. That should open doors to the rest of the Traders.§r

    §o"And then...?"§r

    §2We're bound to find the equipment we'll need to get out of this dimension. Not being able to craft it ourselves, we have to rely on buying it from others instead.

    Check out my Workshop, I'll have some more things to tell you about, as well as guiding you to what we'll need to escape. I'll also have some things for you to buy and sell. Not every Trader has their own shop page, apparently...§r

    §o"Wait, your Workshop? What?"

    §2You'll see. Let's get started.

§3Clay is one of those defining materials of ancient times. It seems so simple, just a maleable material that can be hardened with heat. But the variety of uses helped to push technology forward from the stone age.

    Even to this day, Clay is regularly sought after. It's uses are still numerous.
§3Clay is in constant demand. Even the ramshackle factories some villages have put together rely on Clay to keep them functioning in some way.

§3A small pile of gunpowder has quite an explosive punch when set off. The Creepers who wander the lands usually contain a few piles, but Scav Raiders tend not to let them live very long, as their destructive power can easily punch holes in any base defense.

§3The popular tool of defense and hunting for Mercenaries is a firearm. And firearms tend to require gunpowder to function.

    And so, gunpowder is in demand.

§o"Hey, I recognize this Key... but why isn't it showing where I died? Why isn't your minimap showing it either?"§r

    §2The fabric of magic is a complete mess. So death is a bit more rough in this place. Death no longer leaves as strong a mark on the world, so neither the magic of Tombstone nor my map functions can keep tabs on it.

    The good news? The Grave Key will highlight your grave if its close enough. You can also combine the Grave Key with an Ender Pearl. You can then hold Right Click with the Grave Key to charge up and teleport to your grave.§r 

    "Kind of annoying, but at least all hope isn't lost if I die far from home base."

§2Bandit, I highly suggest you look into how Death's rules work in this dimension.

    Press the [.] (Period) key to open up the Knowledge of Death screen. You can specialize how your death works (just saying that sounds weird...) and also get more information.§r 

    "...I'm sorry, I still can't believe you said "specialize how your death works". That's just kind of creepy, you know?"
Great, where are we now? Time to get our bearings and figure out where we landed this time...

Now that we have our bearings, we need to get to work if we want to get out of here. Z should be able to help us survive.
    [Z will explain mechanics and sell survival items like Waystones and Insurance. Z also has the main questline, as well as Administrative functions like updating the questbook]

This is the first Trader group new Traders and Mercenaries deal with when they want to break into the business. We'll have to prove ourselves and network a bit to talk to more...

    [Trades Vanilla Minecraft and Modular Machinery items.]

The Labrat trade group consists of the most widespread of the Beastfolk races. From their roots, they've become some of the best chemists and engineers.

    [Trades Rats, Alchemistry, Drugs and Pills, and Pneumatricraft items.]

The Flock. A... well, a flock of birds and humans really. They all wear helmets or masks that look like birds, so at a glance its hard to tell them apart, which looks to be the point.

    [Trades ArmorPlus and Techguns items.]

The YAP, a crew of professional (if you can really call it professional...) level looters and... fashionistas. Need to know how to get around, break into abandoned places, and look good doing it? Talk to The YAP

    [Trades Baubley Heart Canisters, Grappling Hook, Hooked, Little Looter, Clothing Plus, and Cloth Mod]

Emporium traders specialize in buying and selling construction materials, furniture, decorations, and more.

    [Trades Chisel, Decocraft, Headcrumbs, Malisis Doors, MrCrayfish's Furniture, Varied Commodities]

Heaven Plaza are a group of undead Traders who have earned the trust of Traders and Villagers alike. They offer lots of different items to mercenaries.

    [Trades Cyclic, Tough as Nails, Quark]
